loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja Sáenz R. pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Maruja tiene 37 años de edad y dos hijos con su esposo que trabaja en la parte administrativa de la UGEL (unidad de gestión educativa) en Yungay. Administra una bodega en su casa que queda en el jr. 02 de mayo Acobamaba en el distrito de Yungay. Ella expende sus productos y menciona que es su mayor satisfacción haber hecho crecer su negocio donde sin muchas dificultades ella ha podido iniciar y mantenerse y de esa manera apoya a su familia, además nos comenta que los miembros de su familia se sienten muy orgullosos de ella. Realiza los pedidos desde la ciudad de Huaraz o compra en los mayoristas de Yungay.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará específicamente con todo el préstamo, arroz, azúcar y leche, porque menciona que ahora han subido mucho los productos, nos cuenta también que ahora la caja de leche cuesta S/ 110. 

Maruja menciona que desearía capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también en su  vida personal.
texts.en:
Maruja Sáenz R. belongs to the communal bank Mujeres at Progreso (“Women Progressing”) in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. Maruja is 37 years old and has two children with her husband, who works in the administrative section of UGEL (UGEL is an administrative unit in charge of many schools in what you would call a "county") in Yungay. She manages a general store in her house, which is located on 2nd of May Street in the Yungay district. She sells her products, and notes that it is a great satisfaction to have made her business grow without many difficulties and help support her family. In addition, she tells us that her family is very proud of her. She fills orders in the city of Huaraz, or she buys from the wholesalers of Yungay. With this loan of 1,200.00 soles, to be canceled in six months, she will specifically purchase rice, sugar, and milk. This is because, as she mentions, prices have gone up quite a bit and a box of milk now costs 110.00 soles. Maruja mentions that she would like to train on how to better improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz de Motupe del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Es soltera, tiene 52 años de edad y vive sola debido a que sus 4 hijos ya formaron sus familias. Comenta que su gran error fue compartir el negocio con su conviviente porque después de tantos años de estar juntos al separarse tuvieron que repartir las utilidades del negocio y trabajar cada uno por su cuenta, es por ello, comenta, que tenía que empezar de nuevo al observar como su negocio había disminuido. Sus hijos no aprovecharon la educación que Modesta les quiso dar, manifiesta, ahora se encuentra sola y trabaja solamente para ella. Vende especerías en la esquina del jr. San Cristóbal y el  jr.13 de diciembre en Huaraz de manera ambulatoria. Compra sus productos de los mayoristas tanto el ají como los condimentos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de ají al por mayor, que le servirá de reserva para los molidos de ají que venderá.
 
Modesta menciona que llegó a su banco comunal por medio de una amiga y que le agrada las reuniones donde puede conversar con ellas y también le gustaría tener talleres para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Modesta belongs to the communal bank “Cruz de Motupe” in the Independencia district of Huaraz of the Ancash department. She is single, 52 years old, and lives alone as her four children now have their own families. She comments that her biggest mistake was to join in the business with her partner because, after many years together, they separated and had to divide the business and work alone afterwards. For this reason, she tells us, she had to start over after seeing how her enterprise had shrunk. Her children did not take advantage of the education Modesta wanted to provide for them, and she now finds herself alone and self-employed. She sells her specialties on foot, from the corner of San Cristóbal and 13th of December Streets in Huaraz. She buys her products from wholesalers, such as hot peppers and condiments. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be canceled in four installments, she will invest in the purchase of hot peppers at wholesale which will be in reserve for the hot pepper paste that she will sell. Modesta mentions that she joined the communal bank through a friend, and that she enjoys the gatherings where she can speak with members. She would like to attend lectures where she could learn how to improve her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hot peppers at wholesale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Miriam es soltera y a sus 21 años de edad está estudiando en una universidad particular. Menciona que su mayor reto ha sido estudiar en una universidad. En la actualidad tiene un negocio de venta de detergente y champú, los cuales lo vende de manera ambulatoria, también menciona que empezó con muy poca inversión, con media caja de jabones específicamente, y ahora vende por cajas los jabones y está creciendo. Su mayor dificultad en su negocio es no tener un puesto de venta estable y el préstamo que ella obtiene por parte del movimiento Manuela ramos la beneficia mucho porque le servirá  para invertir tanto en el negocio como en los estudios.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará una caja de jabones, una bolsa de detergente, un paquete de papel higiénico, una caja de crema dental y otros productos.

Miriam desea recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su vida personal. para que pueda vivir mejor, así mismo para mejorar su negocio y para que ella sepa invertir.
texts.en:
Miriam belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres al Progreso” (“Women Progressing”) in the Yungay province of Ancash. Miriam is single and, at 21 years of age, is studying in the university. She mentions that her greatest challenge has been studying at the university. Currently, she has a business selling detergent and shampoo which she sells on foot. She also mentions that she started with a very small investment, specifically, with a half box of soaps and now she sells them by the carton. Her biggest difficulty with the business is not having a stable place to sell from, and the loan that she obtains through Manuela Ramos benefits her greatly because it will allow her to invest both in her business and her education. With this loan of 1,200.00 soles, to be canceled in six installments, she will purchase one box of soap, one bag of detergent, one packet of toilet paper, a box of toothpaste and other products. Miriam hopes to receive training on how to improve her standard of living so she can live better, as well as for her business and on how to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a box of soaps, a bag of detergent, a packet of toilet paper, a box of toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Raquiel

texts.es:
Raquiel pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Es casada, tiene 56 años de edad, a pesar de haber tenido cuatro hijos no vive con ninguno, pues ella y su esposo se hacen compañía. Menciona que en su vida personal ha podido crecer porque sus hijos son independientes y junto a su esposo ha podido emprender varios negocios, tan es así que ella tiene un restaurante, los puestos Nº 16 y 17 en el mercado de venta de pescados y ahora quiere abrir una cebichería (lugar donde se vende cebiche, comida típica del Perú). También menciona que ha crecido mucho, pero que ahora con el alza de los precios tiene mucha dificultad para vender el pescado, porque antes con el capital que tiene podía comprar toneladas de pescados y ahora compra sólo por kilos siendo esto su mayor dificultad. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará específicamente con todo el préstamo, pescado porque nos cuenta que cada caja cuesta S/.  95 y es necesario invertir mucho.

Raquiel menciona que desearía capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Raquiel belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. She is married and 56 years old. In spite of having had four children she doesn’t live with any of them, as she and her husband live with each other. She mentions that in her personal life she has been able to grow because her children are independent and along with her husband she has been able to start various businesses, such as the restaurant she now has in stands numbers 16 and 17 in the fish market and now she would like to open a “cevichería” (a place where ceviche is sold, a typical cold seafood salad in Peru). She also says that she has grown a lot, but now with the rise in prices it is more difficult to sell fish, because before with the capital she had she was able to buy tons of fish and now she can only buy kilos so this is her greatest challenge. With this loan for S/.3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy specifically with this entire loan, fish, because she tells us that each case costs S/.96 and it is necessary to invest a lot. Raquiel mentions that she would like to educates herself to improve her business and also her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de María tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. La venta de comida es la labor diaria de Flor de Maria, atiende a los balseros, pobladores y turistas que viven y visitan la isla Tata Kily. Empieza su trabajo a las 8 de la mañana, cocinando el almuerzo en su casa y saliendo a remo para llegar  a isla donde vende sus delicias gastronómicas. Aparte de vender comida atiende a los turistas en su pequeña casa de totora, donde también ofrece bebidas gaseosas, energizantes y demás.  El negocio es bueno, ya que le arroja buenas ganancias y puede cubrir con todos sus gastos y ayudar en los gastos familiares. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprar más ingredientes e insumos, así podrá cocinar mayor cantidad de platos y expandir su venta a las otras islas obteniendo así mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Flor de María is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her daily labor involves food sales, tending to the rafters, inhabitants, and tourists who live and visit the island of Tata Kily. She starts her work at 8 am in the morning, cooking lunch in her home and then leaving to travel to the island where she sells her delicious products. Apart from selling food, she caters to the tourists in her small house made of reeds where she also offers sodas, energy drinks, and other items. The business is good, as it provides a good income that allows her to cover her expenses and also help the family’s finances. It is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase more ingredients and supplies so she can cook more food, expand her sales to other islands, and be more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Rosalia Elvira

texts.es:
Rosalía pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y  provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 48 años de edad y dos hijas. Menciona que no ha tenido muchos logros debido a que quedó viuda de un esposo que no se hacía cargo de la familia, es por esta razón que ella siempre vivió como hasta ahora lo hace con su dos hijas. Tiene el negocio de comida que expende en el mercado en el centro ferial de la provincia de Yungay s/n, lugar donde procesa sus alimentos en su puesto, que a la vez aprovecha el lugar de venta para realizar sus compras en el mercado y en especial los días de feria. Menciona que ella empezó con una inversión de S/. 300 y que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, tan es así que actualmente invierte en el proceso de los alimentos y bebidas que tiene en stock en promedio unos S/. 2,000. Día a día sale a vender estos productos con lo cual favorece a toda su familia.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de víveres, como azúcar, arroz, fideos y aceite.

Rosalía se encuentra contenta porque menciona que ha sabido salir adelante y día a día va creciendo y saca adelante a sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Rosalía belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. She is 48 years old and has two daughters. She mentions that she hasn’t had many achievements as she was left widowed by a husband who didn’t support the family, so therefore she has always lived as she is living now with her two daughters. She has a food business in the central market in Yungay province, a place where she prepares her meals in a stall, where she takes advantage of the market locale to do her shopping especially on market days. She mentions that she began with an investment of S/.300 and that little by little she has grown. Today she will invest in the preparation of food and beverages that she can stock with a loan of around S/.2000. Day after day she sells these products which benefits her family. With this loan for S/.2,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in purchasing supplies such as sugar, rice, noodles, and oil. Rosalía is content because she mentions that she has known how to be successful and day after day she is growing and providing a future for her two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Vilma Hermelinda

texts.es:
Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay.

Vilma tiene 44 años de edad, aunque desde joven es madre soltera mantiene a sus 4 hijos de tal manera que apoyó a uno de sus hijos para realizarse profesionalmente, este hecho lo considera uno de sus mayores logros, así como también seguir con su negocio. No considera haber sido una dificultad el mantener a sus hijos, menciona que ha sido un reto y sigue siendo un reto todavía. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto provisional en el campo ferial de la ciudad de Yungay.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos para surtir su puesto.

Vilma afirma que le gustaría recibir charlas para saber llevar mejor su familia y mejorar su negocio
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. Vilma is 44 years old, and as a single mother she has supported her 4 children in a manner that enabled one of her children to become a professional and she considers this one of her greatest achievements, as well as being able to have a successful business. She doesn’t think it has been a difficulty to support her children, she mentions that is has been a goal and continues to be a goal today. Today she sells groceries in a provisional stall in the country market in Yungay city. With this loan for S/.2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in purchasing supplies such as sugar, rice, and noodles to stock her stand. Vilma says that she would like to receive educational talks to know how to take care of her family better and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 48 años, vive solo porque no tienes esposa ni hijos. Samuel se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías para vender a los turistas que llegan de visita a la Isla Tata Kily del Lago Titicaca. Al ser soltero se dedica netamente al trabajo, ha inventado una variedad de souvenirs para los turistas que demandan mucho de sus invenciones, vendiendo además aves disecadas oriundas de la zona. A Samuel le gusta mucho crear, es por eso que es muy paciente y detallista con sus  creaciones, pero muchas veces no dispone del material necesario para realizar lo que el dibuja en su mente. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará material para el relleno de sus aves disecadas, entre otros materiales para poder generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Samuel is 48 years old and lives alone because he is unmarried and does not have children. Samuel makes artisan pieces to sell to the tourists that arrive to visit the Tata Kily Island at Lake Titicaca. Being single he totally focuses on his work, he has created a variety of souvenirs for the tourists who demand many of his inventions; in addition he sells taxidermied birds of the area. Samuel likes to create, he is very patient and pays attention to detail in his work, but many times he doesn’t have the necessary materials to make the products he sees in his mind. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will buy taxidermy materials to stuff his birds among other materials to be able to generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make artisan objects

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos Cristian y Juan Carlos. Se de dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanía, como balsitas hechas a totora, joyeros, collares, móviles, etc, ella vende estos artículos a los turistas que visitan su Isla. La alegre Alicia recibe hospitalariamente a los turistas mostrándole su isla, vistiéndolos con los trajes típicos de la zona y compartiendo toda su cultura. Le gusta mucho compartir e interactuar con los turistas, a quienes ven como amigos que llegan de visita. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará más materiales para elaborar sus artesanías y darles un mejor acabado, y hacerlas más atractivas a los turistas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children, Christian an dJuan Carlos. She makes and sells artisan pieces such as small reed rafts, jewelry, necklaces, mobiles, etc. She sells these items to the tourists that visit her island. Alicia happily receives her tourists with great hospitality and shows them her island, dressing them with the typical clothing of the area and sharing her culture with them. She likes to share and interact with the tourists, whom she sees as friends coming for a visit. This is her first loan with Microfinancas Prisma. With the money she will buy more materials to make her artisan pieces and give them a better finish and detail, making them more attractive to the tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make artisan pieces

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Luz es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora que con su picardía siempre saca una sonrisa a los turistas que visitan su isla, a ella desde niña le ha gustado trabajar es por eso que ahora con sus 22 años, tiene su propio stand donde ofrece sus artesanías. Luz siempre obtiene buenas ventas, ya que es muy sociable y carismática es por eso que quiere expandir su negocio para poder brindarles a sus visitantes mejores y más variadas artesanías. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprara algunas artesanías en barro de la ciudad de Pucara y así poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 22 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s home. Luz is a happy, hardworking young woman who always has a smile for the tourists that visit her island. Ever since she was a little girl she has like to work and that’s why now, at age 22, she has her own stand where she offers her artisan pieces. Luz always has good sales, as she is very social and charismatic and therefore she wants to grow her business to be able to provide her customers better and more varied products. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will buy some ceramic artisan pieces in Pucara city and in this way be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic artisan pieces to sell

loans.name: Nazlum

texts.en: Nazlum is 57 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in the Khirdalan settlement. Ten years ago she started her cleaning business. She would like a loan of 970 AZN to help improve her business.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 35 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She is a registered nurse and she has a clinic attached to her house. She has created a small hall that contains three sick beds where she admits sick patients and another part is a labour room. At the back of her house she built a small poultry farm of about 90 birds. She is requesting  the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more medicine to sell and also to purchase more birds for her poultry business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO Microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and add poultry

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary U. is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs at Mami market. She sells foodstuffs like groundnuts and palm oil, stockfish, tomato paste, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes to make a phone booth to start the sale of rechargeable phone cards.  She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and make a phone booth. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and make a phone booth

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en: R. Falilatu is 55 years old and married with 7 children. She is a hardworking woman. She owns a store where she sells provisions, rents CDs and also sews clothes. She decided to combine these businesses together to enable her meet the demands of her family. She is requesting the loan amount N30,000 to purchase more CDs to rent out to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more CDs to sell

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: Benedict O. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She is a tailor by training. She also included interior decorations to her sewing business so that she can assist her husband in taking care of their children. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more decoration materials for her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more decoration materials

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement A. is 45 years old, married with a child. He does upholstery, a skill he learned for 4 years. His area of specialization is car upholstery and he has been in this business for 13 years. He hopes to have a bigger place where he can attend to more customers. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to buy more upholstery materials for work. He says thank you.

loans.use: To boost the business to buy more materials

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan O. is 55 years old and married with 2 children. He sells provisions and drinks and he sometimes sells cooked food, like pepper soup.  He plans to increase his sales in the area of drinks and provisions as his customers are increasing. Dan's wife is in the picture. She assists her husband in the business. He is requesting N100, 000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia C. is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs like crayfish, palm oil, groundnut oil, tomato paste, etc. She lives in Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for changing her lives.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en: Fikrat was born in 1975. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, and he settled in the Khirdalan settlement. Six years ago he started this business. He transports goods with his truck. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita W., educated through Senior High and married with five dependents, has been selling car spare parts at Siwdo on Cape Coast since 2000. She is responsible for feeding the family and paying for the family’s utility bills. Her husband is a trader.

She is requesting a loan to buy more fan belts, bearings, lubricants and other car parts which are in high demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land to start building a home with her husband for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fan belts, bearings, lubricants and other car parts which are in high demand.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor S., married with three children and educated through Senior High, has prepared yam balls and sausage for sale for the past five years. Victor uses his income to pay school fees and other family expenses. His wife is a caterer.

Victor is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients and supplies to increase food production to meet market demand. He plans to invest the new profits from his expanded operation back into his business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and supplies to increase food production to meet market demand.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad was born in 1968. He is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, and settled in the Khirdalan settlement. This man has sold building materials for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Ugur

texts.en: Ugur is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. Fifteen years ago he started the business of transporting goods with his car. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy additional spare parts.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Niger Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Níger habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Libertad, tiene 44 años de edad, desde muy joven ha trabajado con sus padres pues el negocio de la familia ha sido la venta de marisco, actualmente vende chacalines, ostiones y otros productos de mariscos tiene veinte años en las ventas, sus ventas son bajas cuando hay marea roja, este negocio fue heredado por sus padres, ahora desea invertir mas en compra de marisco para ofertar mas a sus clientes ya que se vende bastante, por eso opciono hacer un préstamo en Afodenic para comprar mas producto de marisco, lo cual desea con esta inversión lograr mas clientes y ingresos. A futuro es comprar un medio de transporte para a si transportar el sus mismo productos.
texts.en:
Niger lives in the Villa Libertad neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. He is 44 years old and has worked with his parents since he was young selling seafood. Today he sells shrimp, scallops and other seafood. He has been selling seafood for 20 years. His sales are low when there is red tide. He inherited this business from his parents, now he wishes to invest in buying more seafood to offer to his customers as he sells quite a bit, and therefore he opted for a loan through Afodenic to buy more seafood products so he can acquire more customers and income. In the future he plans to buy a means of transportation so he can transport his products himself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seafood

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan is 50 years old, is married, has one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is settled in Baku city. He has been in the general store business for fifteen years. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy more goods to help improve his general store.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene 50 años de edad, su esposa le tiene cuatro hijos de 5,7,20 y 25 años de edad, los mayores trabajan y son independiente y los pequeños están cursando primaria, don francisco vende ropa, zapatos, y cosméticos desde hace ocho años lo cual su esposa le ayuda con las venta pues siempre lo apoyado para salir adelante con su familia ya que todo esta caro, cunado inicio lo hizo con fondos de venta de activitos fijos y ayuda familiar, luego comenzó a hacer préstamo en Afodenic lo cual ha sido de gran beneficios  para sus ventas ya que ha invertido mas, con esta solicitud va a comprar ropa para niños y adultos así como cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes, y obtener otros mercado. A largo plazo es comprar tramo en el norte ya que las ventas son muy buenas, ayudar a sus hijos a terminar los estudios, y hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in an area of the capital city of Managua called Laureles Sur. He is 50 years old and he and his wife have four children of 5, 7, 20 and 25 years of age. The eldest of the children work and are independent and the little ones are attending primary school. Francisco sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics and has been doing so for the past 8 years. His wife helps him with the sales, always supporting him to better care for their family, especially because everything is so expensive. When he started out he did it with funds from another business and with the help of his family. Soon after he received a loan from Afodenic, which was a huge help for his sales because he was able to invest more. With this loan request he will purchase clothing for kids and adults as well as cosmetics to offer his clients, and create a new market. In the long term he plans to purchase a stand in the north where the sales are good, help his children finish their schooling, and make home improvements.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for kids and adults and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Wilmer tiene 27 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos que su esposa le tiene de 6 y10 años de edad, los cuales están cursando la primaria en el colegio del barrio de los Laureles Sur, don Wilmer vende contratos ópticos visuales con su esposa desde hace seis años pues es un trabajo que lo hacia ante con su hermana la cual lo oriento para que iniciara solo y pudiera tener sus propias ganancias, viaja en autobús al lado del norte de Nicaragua a mas de 120 kilómetros a lugares de alto riesgos por que la gente no circula mucho, ya que son personas de la montaña Oh lugares largo de la ciudad,  pero para poder obtener clientela y sus venta lo hace, con la solicitud que hace es para comprar aros y lentes para vender mas y ofertar a sus clientela, pues con esta inversión espera obtener expectativas positivas.  A largo plazo es hacer mejoras a su vivienda, educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 27 years old, married, with two children ages 6 and 10 who study in the Laureles Sur neighborhood primary school. For six years Wilmer has sold optical contacts with his wife. He initially worked with his sister, who started him in this business and encouraged him to become independent and generate his own earnings. He travels by bus to the north side of Nicaragua, more than 120 kilometers to high-risk places because there aren’t many people who travel to the people who live in the mountains or other places far from the city. But in order to gain customers and sales he makes the trips. With the loan he plans to buy frames and lenses to sell and offer to his customers, with this investment he hopes to obtain positive expectations. In the long term he plans to make improvements to his home and educate his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy frames and lenses

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en: Nasir is 40 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He has been in food general store business for four years. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy additional food items.

loans.use: to buy  the foodstuffs

loans.name: Socorro Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Socorro tiene 37 años de edad, con cuatro hijos de 3, 8,15 y 20 años de edad, todos están a su cargo y estudian, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de cerdos, compra en la ciudad del rama lo cual viaja a muchos kilómetros de la ciudad por que allá se compran a buen precio y los revende bastante bien. La Sra. Socorro tiene una pulpería desde hace cuatro años con ingresos que su esposo le dio comenzó con poco pero ha ido estabilizando la pulpería, con esta solicitud de préstamo es la segunda pues ha logrado mantener su negocio mas surtido con los préstamo, con esta solicitud es para compra inventario en compra de productos varios y poder sastifacer la demanda de su clientela. A largo plazo es poder hacerla en una miscelánea para vender de todos los productos a sus clientes, cambiar de vehiculo ya que tienen uno viejito donde acarrean los cerdos, y poder dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Socorro is 37 years old, with 4 children ages 3, 6, 15 and 20. She is responsible for all the children as they all study. They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. Her husband has a business selling pigs, he buys them in a city far away because he gets a good price and can then resell them for a profit. Socorro has had a convenience store for four years. She began the store with a little income her husband gave her. This second loan will enable her to maintain her store with inventory to buy various products and be able to satisfy her customers’ demands. Her long term goals are to be able to enlarge her store and sell more products to her customers, get a new car to transport the pigs as they have an old one, and be able to offer an education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products to stock her convenience store

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en: Mushvig is 19 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He has been in the carpentry business for four years.He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 37 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Maria Auxiliadora en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, el negocio de don Francisco es la venta de lubricantes desde hace cuatro años, lo cual inicio con préstamos en una micro financiera, las ventas abecés son bajas debido a la gran competencia de mercado, debido a los altos intereses en otras instituciones, luego opto por Afodenic ya que sus intereses son bajos ya con esta solicitud es la tercera lo cual va a comprar mas productos de lubricantes, ya que tiene bajo el inventario lo cual espera mejorar las venta, como sus ganancias. A largo plazo es pode establecer bien su negocio tener una fosa donde poder hacer los cambios de aceite y también brindar otros servicios, ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios , como también comprar su propia casa ya que habitan en la casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Francisco is 37 years old and he lives in an area called Maria Auxiliadora in the capital city of Managua. His wife has given him a son, now aged 3. Francisco's business for the past four years has been the sale of lubricants. He started the business with loans from a micro financing institution. The sales sometimes are slow given the great competition in the market. Because the interest rates of other institutions were so high, he opted to go with Afodenic because the interest rates are lower. This will be his third loan and with the funds he will purchase more lubricant products to replenish his inventory. This will improve his sales, as well as his income. In the long term he plans to install a car port were he will be able to do oil changes and provide other services as well. He will help his children complete their schooling and he also dreams of purchasing his own home. They currently live in his mother's house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lubricants.

loans.name: Kenia Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Kenia tiene 22 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene una niña de 15 meses, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de zona franca como operario, la Sra. Kenia se levanta desde horas tempranas para poder hacer el desayuno a su esposo y aliñarle el almuerzo ya que a el no le resulta comprar el alimento en su empresa por que es muy caro,  ella vende ropa, zapatos y cosmético desde hace dos años pues inicio vendiendo estos productos a una amiga, luego con las ganancias opto vender ella propia, vende al contado y al crédito, ahora esta solicitando préstamo en Afodenic para invertir mas en la venta de ropa ya que para estos meses se vende bastante en la época de navidad y quiere lograr captar clientes como mejorar su inversión. A largo plazo es comprar un terreno para hacer su propia casa ya que habitan en un cuarto donde  la mama.
texts.en:
Kenia is 22 years old, lives in the Reconciliación Villa neighborhood, and she has a 15 month old daughter. Her husband works in a business as an equipment operator in the industrial park. Enia gets up in the early morning hours to be able to make breakfast for her husband and prepare his lunch as he doesn’t buy lunch at his factory as it is very expensive. She has sold clothing, shoes and cosmetics for two years, beginning selling these products for a friend, then with the earnings she opted to become independent and sell for herself, selling on a cash basis as well as on credit. Now she is asking for a loan from Afodenic to invest in selling clothing as during these months she sells a lot during the Christmas season and she wants to be able to gain more customers to increase her earnings. In the long term she plans to buy a plot of land to build her own home as they currently live in a room in her mother’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 40 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Riguero, tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, pues le ha tocado trabajar mucho para ayudar a su hijo a que estudie para que tenga un nivel de vida mas cómodo, desde Joven a aprendió con su mama hacer vaho tiene diecisietes años en las ventas de comida, refrescos y gaseosas, lo cual inicio con ingresos propios, pero opto para hacer solicitud a Afodenic ya con esta es su tercer solicitud lo cual ha invertido en comprar mas alimentos para la venta de vaho, ya que su clientela ha ido creciendo por sus ricos platillos, con este préstamo desea mejorar la infraestructura del negocio  así como comprar mesas y sillas para brindar un buen servicios a sus clientes. A largo plazo es ampliar el local.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is 40 years old, she lives in a suburb of Managua called Riguero. She has a twenty-two year old son, and is a single mother: so she's worked hard to help her son's studies so that he can have a more comfortable life. When she was young she learnt with her mother to make Vaho (a mix of meat, green plantains and yuca cooked in banana leaves) ,and she now has 17 years experience selling food, snacks and soft drinks. She began this business with her own funds, but then decided to make an application to Afodenic and she's now making her third application. She has invested her loans in buying more ingredients to make Vaho, as her customer base has already been growing thanks to her delicious dishes. With this loan she wants to improve her business' infrastructure, through buying tables and chairs to allow her to offer a good service to her customers. In the long-run, she wants to extend the site.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the roof, purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama 14 febrero de la iglesia fraternidad 1 c al este en la capital de Managua, su esposa vende tortillas, frijoles cosidos, cuajadas y hielo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que tiene tres hijos de 3, 7 y 13 años de edad, dos ellos están estudiando en el colegio del barrio, y se gasta mucho en cuadernos, uniformes. El negocio del sr Carlos son trabajo de metalúrgicos, elabora aparatos para soldadura artesanal desde hace diecisiete años, lo cual a prendió desde muy joven ya que trabajaba en soldadura y de albañil con su papa para ayudar a la familia, con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de materia prima y seguir elaborando productos de soldadura para ofertar a sus clientes, pues gracias a Afodenic ha logrado mantener su negocio estable gracias a sus prestamos y facilidad de pago pues a futuro desea poner su propio taller.
texts.en:
Carlos is 40 years old, lives in a neighborhood named February 14 of the church fraternity 1C to the east in the capital, Managua. His wife sells tortillas, beans, curds and ice to help her husband with the bills since they have three children who are 3, 7 and 13 years old. Two of their children study in the neighborhood school and they spend a lot on notebooks and uniforms. Carlos' business is metallurgical work. He has made equipment for artisanal welding since he ws 17 years old, which he learned when he was young since he worked in welding and masonry with his father to help the family. This loan is to invest in the purchase of raw materials and to continue making welding products to offer to his customers. Thanks to Afodenic, he has been able to keep his business stable thanks to the ease-of-payment loans. In the future, he wishes to establish his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Simona tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama 25 febrero de esta capital de Managua, es madre soltera tiene cuatro hermoso hijos de: 22, 23, 26 y 27 años de edad, los tienen estudiando en la universidad. Pues le ha tocado trabajar mucho para ayudar a sus hijos para que tenga un nivel de vida más cómodo, inicio vendiendo ropa zapatos y mercadería variada, ambulantemente. Gracias a los prestamos ha Afodenic logro comprar un tramo en el mercado y cumplir parte de su objetivo. Los planes son aumentar sus ventas con nuevas mercadería, así mismo nuevos clientes que le generada mejorares ingresos. Que serán para el crecimiento del sus ventas y para formar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Simona is 42 years old, lives in the 25th of February neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is a single mother of four beautiful children ages 22, 23, 26, and 27, all of whom have studied in the university. She has worked hard to help her children have a comfortable standard of living. She began selling clothing, shoes and a variety of merchandise as a street vendor. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she was able to buy a stall in the market and achieve part of her goal. Her plans are to increase her sales with new merchandise and gain new clients to generate more income. She plans to grow her sales and create a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Miriam De La Paz

texts.es: Doña Miriam tiene 32 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Hialiah, tiene tres hermoso hijos de 10,13 y 15 años de edad los tienen estudiando en un colegio del barrio. Su esposo trabaja como celador es un trabajo muy agotador y con poco ingreso. Doña Miriam inicio vendiendo cosméticos para buscar una ayuda mas de dinero, aprendió a elaborar nacatamales y encontró otra forma para generar otro ingreso y hacer helados de diferentes sabores. Sus planes son terminar de construir su casa para proporcionar mejor condiciones a sus hijos. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic le brindara una mayor seguridad a su familia. También  abrir nuevos segmento de mercado con las ventas y sastifacer las necesidades de los clientes e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam is 32 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called Hialiah. She has three beautiful children who are 10, 13, and 15 years old; they study in a nearby school in the neighborhood. Her husband works as a security guard; a very tiring job with a low income. Miriam began selling cosmetics in order to improve her family's income; she also learned how to make tamales and how to make various flavors of ice cream. She hopes to finish building her home to improve the living conditions for her children. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will be able to provide better security for her family, as well as open new segments of the market to satisfy the needs of her customers and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to improve her home

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 43 años de edad vive en barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijas de 12 y 15 años de edad. Es casada y su esposo es guardia de seguridad es un trabajo, en los cuales trabaja las veinte cuatro hora y el día siguiente lo tiene libre lo cual ocupa para ayudar  ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar y hacer parte de los aseo de la casa . Doña Maria trabaja como cajera en una comida rápida desde hace diez meses tiene como metas terminar hacer un cuarto,  para eso va a comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento para poder estar en  mejores condiciones con su familia. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic cada día mejora su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 43 years old and lives in a neighborhood of the capital city of Managua called Memorial Sandino. She has two daughters who are 12 and 15 years old. She is married and her husband is a security guard; at his job, he generally has to work 24 hours straight then has the following day free in which he helps his children to study and helps with the housework. Maria has worked as a cashier at a fast food restaurant for the past 10 months. She has the goal of finishing building a room in her home. In order to do it, she needs to purchase construction materials such as bricks, sand, and cement; in that way, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, each day her living conditions improve.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to put up concrete walls

loans.name: Gladys Ivania

texts.es: La Sra. Gladis tiene 24 años de edad, habita en un bario que se llama Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, soltera con mucho deseo de superación, una de sus meta es seguir estudiando para estar capacitada para administrar bien su negocio oh trabajo, tiene una mini pulpería desde hace un año, lo cual comenzó vendiendo pollo y golosinas, pues ha dejado de estudiar por falta de ingreso pues con este negocio le da para sustentarse, cuando comenzó inicio con fondo que sus padre le dieron , ahora para poder invertir y mantener la pulpería con productos variados esta haciendo su segunda solicitud lo cual le ha beneficiado mucho para seguir en el mercado de los negocios. Con este préstamo va hacer  un bajarete frente de la pulpería ya que a los clientes le da mucho el sol, y quiere dar un mejor servicio a su clientela. A largo plazo es comercializar una nueva variedad de productos para atraer mas clientela y así obtener buenos ingresos para poder ahorrar para estudiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis is 24 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in Managua. Gladis is single and would very much like to get ahead in life. One of her goals is to keep studying to develop her skills as a business manager. Gladis has been running a small store for a year, which she started by selling chicken and sweets. She had to leave school for lack of an income, and this business allows her to sustain herself. She started with a fund that her father provided, and now she can invest in a variety of products for the store. Gladis is in her second loan cycle, and the first loan has benefited her a lot and allowed her to stay in business. With this loan she will construct a porch in front of the store to protect her clients from the sun, because she wants to provide them with the best service. In the long term Gladis would like to sell a greater variety of products to attract more clients and thereby increase her earnings so that she can save for her education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a porch

loans.name: Erika Junieth

texts.es: La Joven Erika Junieth solicita a AFODENIC financiamiento de su primer  crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, construir los servicios higienicos de su casa, trabaja como conserje desde hace 2 años en la Administracion del Juzgado de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que esta clienta no tiene hijos ayuda a su madre y a su abuelita con los gastos del hogar ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, ella se caracteriza por ser una joven muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive en zona # 8 de Nueva Guinea, desde  niña ha aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama que es su familia,  actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad  Martin Lutero, su sueño es llegar a ser una profesional para servirle al pais,  y  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son humildes.
texts.en:
The young Erika Junieth requests from Afodenic her first loan to invest in the remodelling of her home, to put in a bathroom. She has been working as a security guard for the past 2 years at the Courthouse Administration of New Guinea. Although she does not have children of her own she helps her mother and her grandmother with the household expenses, seeing as the financial resources are scarce. She is a very responsible young woman, honest and hard working. She lives in the Zona #8 in New Guinea. Since she was a girl she has learned to work and to value what she loves the most, her family. Currently she is working towards a university degree at Martin Lutero University. Her deram is to become a professional, to serve her country, and to have stable employement so that she can help her poor family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

loans.name: Evelyn Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Evelyn está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6xto crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente de la Escuela César Augusto Salinas PInell desde hace 10 años, tiene una hija de 11 añitos que estudia su quinto grado, su esposo trabaja como albañil y comparten los gastos del hogar, además ayuda  a cuidar a sus ancianos padres;  Evelyn es una mujer  con alto espiritud de superación personal, muy responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños  a aprender a leer y escribir en la zona urbana de la Nueva Guinea ,  su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con créditos anteriores inicio poco a poco a mejorar sus condicones de vida y de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn is seeking refinancing for a sixth loan to invest into making improvements to her home (building a new room). She has worked as a teacher at the César Augusto Salinas Pinell School for the past 10 years. She has an 11-year old daughter who is in fifth grade. Her husband works in construction and they share the household expenses. In addition, she helps to take care of her elderly parents. Evelyn has high hopes of personal success, is very responsible, and an educator who loves her work since she helps many children learn to read and write in an urban zone of New Guinea. Her dreams include finishing her degree in Education Sciences, having stable employment, good health, living in a home with better conditions. She is thankful to AFODENIC, since the previous credits have allowed her to slowly improve her living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a new bedroom.

loans.name: Thelma Elizzette

texts.es: La Sra. Thelma tiene 35 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Oscar Turcio, con dos hijos, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como contador, pues también ella trabaja de contadora para una farmacia y aprovecha a vender cosméticos y ropa, para obtener más ingresos, tiene tres años en las ventas, lo cual inicio vendiendo ropa al crédito y al contado  a sus compañeros de trabajo con capital propio, con esta solicitud de préstamo es la cuarta en Afodenic pues ah invertido en su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y trabaja mucho por pedidos, con este préstamo desea invertir en mercadería de ropa, pues es de gran beneficios los préstamo que ahora le otorgan ya que cada día logra captar mas clientes con sus variedad de productos. A largo plazo es poder tener una tienda de ropa en su cada y dedicarse por completo al negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thelma is 35 years old and lives in a neighborhood call Oscar Turcio with her two children and her husband. He works as an accountant and she does as well for a pharmacy. She also sells cosmetics and clothing to earn a greater income. She has worked in sales for the past 3 years, beginning selling clothing on credit to her co-workers with her own capital. This is the 4th time she has requested a loan from Afodenic; she has used the other loans to invest in her business as she has many customer order to fulfill. With this loan, she will invest in more clothing to sell; the variety of products she offers will allow her to gain more customers. In the long-term, she would like to have a clothing store in her home where she can work full-time in clothing sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults, and cosmetics

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia V.  tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el Km. 10 ½ carretera a Masaya junto a su esposo eh hijos esta señora de desempeña como docente desde hace 15 años , el esposo trabaja como vendedor en Agricor desde hace siete año con mucho esfuerzos de parte de la paraje han logrado poco a poco y con el financiamiento de Afodenic a obtener mejores condiciones de vida, esta señora solicita el monto de c$ 10,000.00 córdobas para terminar de construir su vivienda la mayor dificultad que han tenido en años atrás era la falta de financiamiento ya que es Docente .
texts.en:
Ms Karla Patricia V. is 36 years old and lives in Masaya with her husband and children. This client has worked as a teacher for the last 15 years, her husband has worked as a salesman for Agricor for the past 7 years. With much effort on the part of this couple and with financing from Afodenic, bit by bit, they have improved their living conditions. This client is asking for a loan of c$ 10,000.00 córdobas in order to finish the construction of her home. The greatest obstacle which they have had in years past has been a lack of funding because she is a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build walls inside her house

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is 30 years old, and is married with one child He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. Ten years ago he started baking bread for a living. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary products to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary products for improving his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. L. is 25 years old. She is married with no children. Currently Esther sells phone items like phone cards and credits cards. Esther loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been selling these cards for years to support her family. She sells these items in the morning through to the evening and in the evening she adds beverages such as coffee, Milo, and tea in addition to the cards she sells. Mobile phone cards are purchased by many people due the number of people who have access to phones and the kind of human relation she has with her customers. She takes delivery of stock from wholesalers who provide her with a direct supply and retails it to her customers. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the wholesalers and resell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, she wants to buy assorted phone cards in bulk, Milo, tea, etc. to serve her customers. She hopes this will enable her to save more to support rapid business growth. Esther is a member of a borrowing group called (Matiti) ‘Nyame Bekyere’ Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: For the purchase of phone cards and credits cards and tea, coffee ingredients.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina S. is 37 years old. She is married with one child who is currently in school. She is a supplier and a trader who trades in bulk foods stuff like bags of onions and beans and supplies them to her customers at the busy market of Ashaiaman where she lives. Amina treks to the some of the West African countries like Benin to purchase her goods. She needs the loan to buy more stock to scale up the business. She wants to buy more bags of beans and onions to increase her inventory. She hopes to double her savings to take care of her kid in school.

She belongs to the community group called ‘So mu yie’ (handle with care) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and onions.

loans.name: Sapheun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sapheun P. is the leader of this three-member group. They all live in Svaypoar Commune of the Battambang Province, in Cambodia.

Mrs. Sapheun P. is 62 years old, and she sells Khmer fritters and grilled banana from her cart in the local Tom Market. Sapheun has five married children. Her husband, Mr. Sari Sey, 67, is blacksmith. Sapheun requests a loan of $250 to buy a cart to make working easy. The loan will help them increase their income to sustain their family’s payment.

Mrs. Sorn M. is 20 years old. She sells soy bean juice. Sorn requests a loan of $250 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

Mrs. Thouk S., 56, sells groceries. She requests a loan of $250 to buy more groceries to resell in her store.

loans.use: Buy a cart for selling fritters and grilled bananas

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị Bùi Thị Thuỷ năm nay 35 tuổi, Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay để đầu tư vào kinh doanh. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang kinh doanh bia và hàng khô cho thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập này kinh tê gia đình chị đng ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn mua thêm bia về bán
texts.en:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Thuỷ is 35 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. She invested her first loan in a business. Today, her family retails beer and dried goods for an income of 2,500,000 VND per month. With this level of income, the family's financial situation continues to improve each day. For the upcoming loan, she hopes to borrow 9 million VND to put towards purchasing more beer to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Loan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Kiều Thị Loan tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 300.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, đến nay qua 12 năm sử dụng vốn hiệu quả công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao hơn.Hiện nay thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đạt 2 triệu đồng/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi vịt của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Loan Thi K. joined the TYM fund in 1996. The first loan of 300,000 Vietnamese Dong was invested in livestock. After 12 years, the business is becoming more and more fruitful. Now, income from livestock reaches 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Mrs. K. plans to make the next loan of 8,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy food supply for her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Châm năm nay 40 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia tại Quỹ chị Châm không chỉ hoàn trả vốn đúng quy định mà chị còn luôn chấp hành  tốt mọi quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài làm ruộng gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm cá thả tại ao nhà cho thu nhập 3,5 triệu đồng/ tháng . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15 triẹu đồng để đầu tư cho công việc nuôi cá của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thi Nguyen, 40 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 1995. In the whole time in which she has been participating in the Fund, Mrs. Nguyen not only repaid the loan according to the terms, but she also satisfied all other conditions which the Fund established. Currently, besides farming, her family also runs a fish farm in a pond at their home with an income of 3.5 million VND per month. In this round of funding she is requesting 15 million VND to invest in the fish farming business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fish farming business

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vân  năm nay 30 tuổi hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Huyện Mê Linh tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 2004 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào công việc buôn bán phế liệu. Hiện nay ngoài  buôn bán phế liệu gia đình chị Vân còn đầu tư vốn chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình . Với sự giúp đỡ của chồng công việc chăn nuôi , buôn bán của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua hêm 2 con lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thi Ngo, 30 years old, currently lives with her husband and children in Me Linh, Vinh Phuc. In 2004 she joined the Fund and borrowed money to invest in a recycling business. Currently besides trading recycled materials, her family also raise livestock to increase the family's income. With the help of her husband in the livestock work, the business is expanding and doing very well. In this round of funding she is requesting 15 million VND to invest in buying 2 large pigs and feed to serve the livestock needs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị T. năm nay 49 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1995 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chồng và các con của chị còn đi buôn bán cá tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 2,5 triệu đồng/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị T. đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua bò về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs T. is 49 years old. She has 4 children, 3 are grown up. In 1995 she joined TYM fund to get capital to start a pig raising business. Today, she, her husband and their children also sell fish to increase their earning. Their monthly income is 2.500.000 VND. Their financial situation is stable. For this round of loan Mrs T. is seeking 15.000.000 to buy calves to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đãi năm nay 52 tuổi, chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.  Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc thu mua phế liệu của chồng. Mức thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình chị đạt 3 triệu đồng. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 13 triệu để đầu tư vốn mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con dịa phương.
texts.en:
Chị Đãi is 52 this year. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 1995. She put her first loan towards raising pigs. After participating in the fund for a period of time, her family invested in a general goods retail business. Currently, outside of the income from their retail business, they have an additional source of income from her husband's business of gathering and buying of scraps. The family's monthly average income is 3 million VND. For this loan cycle, she is asking to borrow 13 million VND to purchase more retail products that meet the demands of the local community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General Store - Retail Business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đại năm nay 35 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1995 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian  chăn nuôi lợn hiệu quả gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt. Hiên tại với sự hỗ trợ thêm của chồng và các con công việc chăn nuôi của gia đìnhchị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3,5 triệu/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12 triệu để đầu tư vốn mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc  chăn nuôi vịt của gia đình
texts.en:
Chị Đại is 35 this year. Her family has three school-aged children. In 1995, she joined the TYM Fund borrowing capital to invest in the business of rearing pigs. After a period of time, as they got good results from the pig rearing business, her family diligently borrowed more funds to raise ducks. Currently, with her husband and children assistance, the family's animal rearing business is growing successfully and provides an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND during this loan cycle to purchase animal feed for the family's pig and duck rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animal feed for family's pig and duck rearing business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 2 triệu đồng để đầu tư cho việc chăn nuôi lợn. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Hương luôn sử  dụng vốn hiệu quả, hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn và chấp hành tốt các quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ lương thợ xây của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15 triệu đồng, một phần chị đầu tư mua lợn giống về nuôi phần còn lại chị dự định đầu tư xây dựng bioga để phụcvụ cho công việc chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập 3,5  triệu/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Nguyen has been participating in the fund since 2001. In the first round of funding she borrowed 2 million VND to invest in raising pigs. In the whole time in which she has been participating in the Fund, Mrs. Nguyen has always utilized the loan with successful results, making all repayments on time and satisfying all other conditions of the Fund. Currently besides income from the livestock, her family also has an income stream from her husband's salary as a construction worker, so the family's finances are very stable. In this round of funding she is borrowing 15 million VND, part of which go towards purchasing a sow to raise, and the remainder of which will be used to invest in a biogas system to serve the livestock operations. The family's income is 3.5 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sow, construct biogas system

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Luận năm nay 57 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Trong suốt 5 năm qua chị Luận luôn sử dụng vốn vay vào công việc buôn bán phế liệu của gia đình.Hiện nay với thu nhập 3.000.000đ từ buôn bán phế liệu và lương làm thuê của chồng kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng đầu tư vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 57 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 2003. In the past 5 years, Mrs. Nguyen has always used the loan towards the family's recycling business. Currently, with an income of 3 million VND from trading recycling materials and her husband's income as labor-for-hire, the family's finances is very stable and growing day-by-day. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in buying recycling materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to be recycled

loans.name: Kim Thi

texts.vi: Chị Kim Thị Liệu năm nay 48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 5 năm. Hiện nay nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là từ buôn than và công thợ xây của chồng và con. Hàng ngày chị đi lấy than về đóng và bán cho người dân địa phương còn chồng và con lớn đi làm thợ xây nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 4 triệu đồng/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Liệu đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn mua thêm nguyên liệu phụcv ụ cho công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh than của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Kim, 48 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 5 years. Currently her family's main source of income is from selling coal and her husband's and son's salary as construction workers. Everyday, she takes coal home and packs it to sell to the locals, while her husband and oldest son work, so the family's total income is very stable. With an income of 4 million VND/month, the family's life is improving day by day. In this round of funding, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in buying more raw materials to use in the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to be recycled

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hồng 35 tuổi chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 2 triệu đồng để đầu tư vào buôn bán phế liệu. Công việc ngày càng thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ổn định. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đìnhchị ngày càng ổn định. Do vậy gia đình chị cũng có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc buôn bán phé liệu của gia đình
texts.en:
Chị Hồng - 35 years old - has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. With her first loan of 2,000,000 VND, she invested in a scrap/waste exchange business. The line of work continues to be favorable and provides a steady income. Currently it is also her family's main source of income. With an income of 3,000,000 VND per month, her family's living conditions continue to improve. Therefore, her family also has plans to put money towards the children's educations. For this loan cycle, she is asking for 9,000,000 VND to put towards the family's scrap/waste exchange business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the family's Scrap/Waste Exchange Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 41 tuổi. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán. Ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương thợ xây của chồng và con trai. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Thảo đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vón cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thảo is 41 years old. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed to invest in a retail business. In addition to the income from the retail business, her family get additional income monthly from her husband's and son's construction worker salaries. With an income of 4,000,000 VND per month, each day Mrs. Nguyễn's family's financial situation becomes more stable and gets better. This upcoming loan cycle, she wants to borrow 15,000,000 VND to put towards the family business in an effort to further improve their income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Xuân Thị Hà 35 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập 1.500.000đ từ việc buôn bán phế liệu của chị Hà gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập khoảng 1.500.000 từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập này  không chỉ chi tiêu và hoàn trả vốn vay theo quy định gia đình chị Hà còn có thể tiết kiệm để đầu tư cho các con ăn học ngày càng tốt hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn đi buôn bán phế liệu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân Thị Hà is 35 years old. She's been participating in the TYM Fund since 2003. She has two school-aged children. Her current monthly income from her scrap/waste exchange business is 1,500,000 VND. Her family also gets additional income from her husband's salary as a construction worker, which is about 1,500,000 VND. With this income level, she is able to repay her loans and cover family expenses. Mrs. Hà can also save to give her children a good education. For this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in her scrap/waste exchange business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Scrap/Waste Exchange

loans.name: Duong  Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đường Thị Sự năm nay 34 tuổi, hiện hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Năm 2003 chị Sự đã xin tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay thêm vốn đầu tư cho kinh doanh. Sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị Sự đã có nhiều đổi thay. Hiện tại thu nhập từ buôn bán của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Đường Thị Sự is 34 years old. She and her husband sell basic goods. In 2003 Sự joined TYM fund to have capital to invest in her business.. After 5 years with TYM, her family financial situation has improved a lot. Today, their income from the sales is 3.000.000 VND a month. aFor this round of loan, Mrs Sự would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND to continue investing in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon S. is the leader of this group loan. All three entrepeneurs live in Sarikakeo Commune in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Khon S. is 43, and she goes throughout her village selling fish that her husband caught. Mrs. Khon S. also takes cares of her seven children. Two children help with the family's income by fishing and decorating houses for ceremonies or wedding parties. Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Mach Kheav, is 42, and has always been a fisherman. Khon requests a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets, and a second-hand fishing boat for her husband.

Mrs. Saroeun C. is 56 years old, and a rice farmer. She requests a loan for $300 to purchase fishing equipment.

Mrs. Seun S. is a 55-year-old widow. She makes mats and sells them from home. Seun requests a loan of $300 to purchase the raw materials to make mats.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets and a second-hand boat for fishing

loans.name: Nasreen Irshad Ali Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a very energetic woman. She was born in the city of Sahiwal, but she moved to the city of Burewala when she married her husband, I.. I. is in the business of stitching and selling undergarments. They have four children: three sons and one daughter. Her two eldest sons work in their father's business, her youngest son has an animal skin selling business, and her daughter is a student in the 7th standard.

Nasreen baji operates a business where she sews clothes. More specifically, she takes sewing orders from the people in her neighborhood and in the surrounding communities, and she completes such orders for a price of $2 per suit. By doing so, she is proud of the fact that she is able to help support her family. Nasreen baji has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a third loan from Asasah to buy animal skins to expand her youngest son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by two other members: Noor Jehan baji seeks a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell, and Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her son's business by purchasing additional animal skins

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Shamama is 37 years old and has two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. She has been in the general store business for fifteen years. She would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy goods to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foods

loans.name: Bayram
