texts.en: Bayram is 44 years old, and is married with three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He started a clothing business eight years ago. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to additional shoes and clothes to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Shakeela M.saleem Group

texts.en:
Shakeela baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past 2 years. She is the mother of eight children: six daughters and two sons. Her two eldest daughters are married, her third daughter is a teacher, and her other daughters stay at home where they help her make decorative, embroidered dresses. As for her sons, her oldest son works at a catering business (and she notes that he has been in this business for the past 8 years), while her youngest son is a student in the 8th standard. Shakeela baji’s husband has a (chicken) meat-selling business.

As alluded to above, Shakeela baji herself has a decorative, embroidery business. Specifically, she takes orders for embroidered dresses from her customers, and she then makes such dresses to earn a profit. Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to buy materials (e.g., utensils, chairs, and table clothes) to help expand her son’s catering business.

Shakeela baji is joined in her loan group by four other members: Fazilat baji seeks a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads, beads, clothes, and sketches) to display in her boutique; Shamim baji requests a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads and clothes) for her decorative, embroidery business; Wakeelan baji would like a loan to buy engine oil to resell; and Fatima baji is in need of a loan to buy colors for her tie-die business. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her son's catering business by purchasing additional materials (e.g., utensils, chairs, and table cloths)

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en: Djamil is 48 years old, and is married with two children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He has been in the carpentry business for six years. He would like a loan 970 AZN to buy the necessary materials to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.name: Bashiran M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past 12 years. She is the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. Her older son is a bus driver (he drives a local, 32-seat bus), and her younger son is a student in the 9th standard. As for her daughters, her oldest daughter is a student in the 9th standard, her middle daughter is in the 6th standard, and her youngest daughter is in the 3rd standard. For the past 10 years, Bashiran baji’s husband has owned and operated a spare parts business, where he specializes in selling bicycle parts.

Meanwhile, Bashiran baji herself has a sewing business: she takes sewing orders from clients in her neighborhood, and she then completes such orders for a profit. She notes that she has been sewing clothes for the past 25 years, and that she began in this line of work when she was just 13 years old. Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more bicycle spare parts to expand her husband’s business.

Bashiran baji is joined in her loan group by three other members: Hanifan baji seeks a loan to buy materials (e.g., wood and nails) for her furniture business (she makes wooden benches); Sharifan baji requests a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to resell; and Rehana baji would like a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's business by purchasing additional bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly C. is the leader of this three-member group in Tongrong Commune in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. Ly is 47 years old, and she has four children, three of whom are working. Her husband, Mr. Va Nouv, is 44 years old. Va is a rice farmer and also a carpenter. He does repairs and builds structures in the area around their village. Since 1985, Ly has been a farmer. She requests a loan of $150 to buy more construction materials for her husband’s business. This will help them earn more for their daily food.

The other two members of the group are also farmers. Mr. Chhantry H. is 69 years old, and a rice farmer. He requests a loan of $150 to purchase furniture for his house. Mrs. Saron I. is 44 years old, and a rice farmer. She requests a loan of $50 to buy fertilizer to improve the yield of the rice crop.

loans.use: Buy more construction materials for carpentry business

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat I. was born in 1982 and is the mother of two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region. Nazakat is in the Khirdalan settlement.

Nazakat has run her business for six years, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy additional foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Aliheydar

texts.en:
Aliheydar H. was born in 1972. Aliheydar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Agdam region. He is in the Khirdalan settlement.

He has been in the cafe business for six years, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy necessary items for the cafe.

loans.use: To buy necessary items for the cafe

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyến 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy Tình Thương gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do không có vốn để phát triển kinh tế.Sau khi tham gia quỹ nhờ đồng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn chăn nuôi, trồng trọt từ đó  kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, đến nay gia đình chị đã mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị cho gia đình như: Ti vi, tủ lạnh, xe máy ....Chị có 2 con hiện nay các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư nuôi 500 con vịt giống.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tuyến is 41 years old, a TYM fund member since 1997. Before joining TYM fund, her family was having great difficulties because they did not have capital. With the loans from TYM fund, she started raising poultry and cultivating and since then her family's financial situation improves. She has been able to buy things like a fridge, a tv, motorcycle. She has 2 children who are still in school. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to raise 500 breeding ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị L. 45 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1996, chị có 3 con, 2 con  hiện đang đi học, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, chồng chị làm nông nghiệp ngoài những lúc nhàn rỗi anh vân thường hỗ trợ chị trong công việc kinh doanh, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị rất phát triển thu nhập bình quân hàng ngày 150.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ đầu tư mua hàng hóa.
texts.en:
Mrs Phạm Thị L. is 45 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1996. She has 3 children, 2 of which are still in school, the other one is already married. Her husband is a farmer. In his free time he would help her out tending her grocery store. Loans from last rounds were invested in her store. It is a successful business. Her family income is 150.000 VND a day. This time she is seeking a L. of 12.000.000 VND to buy more products for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Bùi 50 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997, chị sinh được 3 con, 2 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 1 con đang sống cùng chị và đang đi làm thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng, chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân 60.000đ/ ngày. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi và trồng cây ăn quả. Hiện tai gia đình chị có hơn 300 gốc cây ăn quả bình quân môi năm thu nhập 40.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ mua thêm 500 con giống cây trồng và phân bón.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Bùi is 50 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1997. She has 3 children, 2 of which are married and have their own family. The last one holds a job making 1.500.000 VND a month and still lives with her. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver, he makes 60.000 VND a day. All her loans are invested in raising animal and cultivating fruit plants. Today she and her family have more than 300 fruit plants. Their revenue from this is about 40.000.000 VND a year. This time she is seeking a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy 500 new plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1998. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huế 34 tuổi, mặc dù tuổi đời con trẻ nhưng chị laị rất ham làm kinh tế, tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ, các vòng vốn đều được gia đình chị sử dụng hiệu quả thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị đều tích lũy, kết hợp với vay vốn các vòng tiếp theo gia đình chị đã mở được một cửa hàng tạp hóa với đa dạng mặt hàng, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn bán thêm các thiết bị điện dân dụng, chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huế is 34 years old, she is a TYM fund member since 1998. Despite her young age she is an ambitious entrepreneur. Initially she used her loan from TYM to start a small retail business selling stuff. Later rounds of loans were used effectively, from a small business she now owns a grocery store that offers a lot of products. Beside the grocery , her family also sells electric appliances. Mrs Huế has 2 children who are school aged. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 to invest in her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Được 34 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy Tình Thương kinh tế  gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn để kinh doanh, được sự giúp đỡ của chị em trong xóm giới thiệu chị đã tham gia Quỹ, nhờ đồng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để mở rộng kinh doanh mua thêm hàng về bán như quạt điện, máy say sinh tố, từ đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. Thu nhập bình quân từ bán hàng mỗi ngày 200.000đ. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhâp 60.000đ/ ngày, chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Được is 34 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1997. Before joining TYM she and her family were facing difficult time due to lack of money to start a business. With the help and support from her friends from the neighbourhood, she joined TYM fund to get a loan. She bought and sold electric goods like fans, electric blender ... .Since then her family's finance has improved. On average she makes 200.000 VND. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver making 60.000 VND a day. She has 2 school aged children. This time she is requesting a loan of 15.000.000 to buy grocery to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invets in her grocery store

loans.name: Tinh

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Tính 32 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Khác với nhiều chị em phụ nữ khác ở vùng nông thôn chị sống đơn thân không đi xây dựng gia đình do vậy lúc trước khi chưa vào Quỹ chị không biết làm gì để tăng thu nhập.Chị đã được giới thiệu vào Quỹ Tình Thương khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã có cơ hội vay vốn và học tập các chị em khác trong việc kinh doanh và buôn bán. Sau 10 năm tham gia quỹ chị đều vay vốn đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, công việc kinh doanh của chị diễn ra thuận lợi đến nay chị đã có 1 của hàng tạp hóa khang trang với nhiều loại mặt hàng khác nhau. Thu nhập từ cửa hàng bình quân 150.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 12.000.000đ mua thêm hàng hóa
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Tinh is 32 yrs old; and joined the TYM fund in 1997. Unlike other women living in the countryside, she has never married and, therefore, before joining the fund she did not know what to do to increase her income. When she joined the fund, she was able to learn from the other women in the group the business and commerce skills. After 10 years in the fund borrowing money and investing in a grocery store, her business did quite well and she now has a spacious store selling a variety of products. Average income from the store is 9 USD per day. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 725 USD to purchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Huong

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Hương 37 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị còn rất khó khăn do thiếu vốn để làm ăn. Hoàn cảnh gia đình chị gặp nhiều éo le chồng mất sớm một mình chị nuôi 2 con nhỏ. Vượt qua số phận chị đã tham gia Quỹ vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vốn vào làm Hương, gia đình chị đã có nhiều năm làm nghề hương nên hầu hết các khách hàng của chị đều là khách hàng quen thuộc. Bình quân thu nhập của gia đình chị là 3.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ mua nguyên vật liệu làm hương
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Huong is 37 yrs old, and joined the TYM fund in 1997. Before joining the fund, her family was having a difficult time and did not have any capital to start any kind of business. Her life circumstances were troublesome; her husband died at an early age so she had to raise their 2 small children alone. To overcome her fate, she joined the fund to borrow money to improve her economic situation. She invested the prior loans in a business making incense. After many years in this business, she has many repeated customers. Average income for her family is 210 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase supplies for making incense.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Diep

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Điệp 33 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu là kinh doanh và chồng đi làm, hiện tại gia đình chị đang kinh doanh nhiều mặt hàng như: Đồ mỹ nghệ, hàng tạp hóa, ngoài công việc kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có nghề làm hương thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định, chồng chị làm nghề lái xe thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học, tới đây gia đình chị có kế hoạch  mở rộng mô hình làm hương. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ mua nguyên vật liệu làm hương.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Diep is 33 years old, and joined the TYM fund in 1997. Her family's main source of income is their retail business, and her husband works outside the home. Presently, her business sells different grocery products and miscellaneous gift items. In addition to her store, she also makes and sells incense so her family's income is very stable. Her husband works as a driver and makes 180 USD per month. They have 2 children and both are currently in school. Her family has plans to expand their incense-making business. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase materials for making incense.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make incense

loans.name: Khanh

texts.vi: Chị Phạm thị Khanh 52 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Chị sinh được 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành và xây dựng gia đình, 1 con đang sống cùng vợ chồng chị. Những năm đầu vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu  tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi được gia đình chị tích lũy dần và đầu tư vốn vào buốn bán hoa quả và bánh kẹo, công việc buôn bán của chị rất phát triển thu nhập đều đăn hàng ngày, chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân 70.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán hoa quả, bánh kẹo.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Danh is 52 years old, and joined the TYM fund in 1997. She has 3 children, 2 are grown and have their own family; the other child is living with her and her husband. During the earlier years with the fund, she invested the loans in raising pigs and chickens. From the money they were able to make raising animals, they saved enough to invest in a shop selling fruits, vegetables and sweets. Her business does very well, making money everyday. Her husband works outside the home, giving rides on his moped, and he makes average 4 USD per day. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 600 USD to invest in her fruits and vegetables shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nhat

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Nhát 60 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị xin vay 500.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau 1 vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị nhận thấy rằng việc vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi rất hiệu quả, các vòng vốn vay tiếp theo gia đình chị đều vay vốn ở mức cao sửa sang chuồng trại và chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn, tới đây gia đình chị có kế hoạch đầu tư vốn trồng cây ăn quả với số lượng lớn. Chị có 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 1 con đang sống cùng chị hàng ngày đi làm thu nhập 2000.000đ/ tháng. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị 30.000.000đ/ năm. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000 đầu tư mua con giống.
texts.en:
Ms. L. Thi Nhat is 60 years old, and joined TYM fund in 1997. Her first loan of 30 USD was invested in raising pigs. Her family found that investing the loans in raising pigs was very effective for them. The subsequent loans were of higher amounts and used to remodel and enlarge the pigsty. Presently her family has plans to invest in growing a large number of fruit trees. She has 3 children, 2 are grown and living on their own. The other child still lives with her and is currently employed, making 120 USD per month. Income from her pig farm is 1800 USD per year. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase young trees to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fruit trees to grow

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey V. is the president of a village bank [solidarity borrowing group] of thirteen people who all live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Srey V. is a farmer who owns 3 hectares to cultivate rice for a living. On this plantation she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to enable the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Chantha, is a policeman who can make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Srey V. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to enable the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mrs. Sor Mean Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank [solidarity group] consists of twelve people in Kandal Kraom Village. Mrs. Sor M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small rice field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. M. Touch, is a fisherman. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough fishing tools. Thus, Mrs. Sor M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. She hopes her husband can gather more fish to support the family. Mrs. Sor M. is 47 years old and the mother of eight children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one owns a beauty salon shop. Another four are enrolled in the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are two and five years old.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Sophal Cheng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C. is the group leader of seven people who are all living in Kaoh Reah Leu Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sophal C. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Chin Sithuon, is a fisherman who can gather little fish because he now has insufficient fishing tools. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sophal C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. Mrs. Sophal C. is 54 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while two are attending the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To to buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị T. năm nay 51 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Trong suốt 5 năm tham gia Quỹ chị T. luôn là thành viên gương mẫu, hoàn trả đúng quy định và chấp hành tốt các quy chế của Quỹ. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là buôn bán thịt lợn, chăn nuôi và lương thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ  gia đình chị T. hiện là một trong những hộ gia đình thành viên  có thu nhập ổn định nhất trong Cụm.
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay  9.000.000 để mua lợn về thịt cung cấp nguồn thực phẩm cho bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Ms. Luu Thi Hanh is 51 years old, and has been a member of TYM fund since 2003. In the 5 years she has been with the fund, she has always been a model member, paying back the loans on time, and implementing the fund's regulations. Presently, her family's main source of income is from raising pigs, selling their meat, and from her husband's job as a carpenter. With average income of 245 USD per month, her family is one of the families in the fund that have the most stable income. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase additional pigs to raise and selling their meat to the local people.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people in Stueng Village in Kandal Province make up the village bank [solidarity group] taking out this loan. All the members in this village bank will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sao M. is a village bank president, who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she breeds pigs. As her pigs are bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy pig food. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food to feed her pigs. Mrs. Sao M. is a 46-year-old widow with a child who is a car driver for a company. That child can make a small salary to support the household.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị M. là một phụ nữ không gặp nhiều may mắn trong cuộc sống  do chồng chị  không may mất sớm một mình chị phải nỗ lực để nuôi hai con còn nhỏ. Chị M. tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhằm tăng  thu nhập cho gia đình nhưng sau đó nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế không cao nên chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay với mức thu nhập 2000.000đ đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.     
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm một số mặt hàng phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của bà con địa phương và từ đó tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Chị M. is a woman that has experienced many hardships. Because her husband passed at an early age, she has had to work as a single parent to care for her two young children. Chị M. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. In the beginning, she borrowed capital for rearing livestock to produce income for the family but after a while, she realized that the business did not help them bring in much income. Therefore, she diligently borrowed funds to invest in a retail business selling sundries. Currently their income is 2,000,000 VND and is also the main source of income for the family. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow an additional 9,000,000 VND to purchase more improved personal sundries/items that are in demand and from there increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira Y. was born in 1979 and lives in the Khirdalan settlement.

Sabira has been in the bakery business for two years. She bakes bread and biscuits, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy products needed for baking.

loans.use: To buy products needed for baking

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Хакназарова Фотима проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Живут дружно  и весело. Уже восемь лет занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке города. Имеет торговую точку. Точку арендует на ежемесячной основе. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Торгует одеждой. Сейчас планирует получить кредит для ввоза товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima H. lives in the city Tursun-zoda with her husband and four children. Their family is close-knit and happy. She has already been working in sales for eight years. At her stall in the city market she sells clothes that she transports from the city Dushanbe. She pays monthly rent for the market stall. Now she would like to take out a loan for transporting goods. She will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Mrs. Cheang Im Sreng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank [solidarity borrowing group] consists of nineteen people and is located in Preak Reang Kandal Province. Mrs. Cheang Im S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a Khmer cake seller who can make a small income through her business. Her husband, Mr. Khlar Bunthong, is a farmer and pig breeder. Because the second business is going well, he wants to expand it. So Mrs. Cheang Im S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Cheang Im S. is 41 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local schoO..

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Bibiroziya

texts.ru: Носирова Бибирозия жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 33 года. Не замужем,имеет одного ребенка. Для того, чтобы прокормить семью , занимается бизнесом. Торгует различными бытовыми предметами. Торговая точка находится на центральном рынке. Занимается бизнесом уже 2 года. Товар привозит из города Душанбе, где покупает в оптовых магазинах. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и получить доход.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibiroziya N. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 33 years old. She is not married and has one child. In order to feed her family, Bibiroziya has a business. She sells a variety of household items. Her sales location is at the central market. Bibiroziya has been in business for 2 years. She brings her products in from Dushanbe where she purchases them at wholesale stores. Bibiroziya plans to take out a loan in order to increase her inventory. This will help her to attract new customers and to earn a profit. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in perfumes, beauty soaps, body lotions and other similar goods for a small store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling underwear.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en:
Adalat was born in 1953.  He is a widower and has 4 children.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Djabrayil region, settled in Baku city. 

He has been in the house repair business for 10 years.  Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for repairing houses.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for repairing houses

loans.name: Nusratullo

texts.ru: Вохидов Нусратулло фермер . Уже четыре года занимается животноводством. Закупает бычков , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , а затем продает на рынке. Имеет несколько голов животных , но планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность увеличить доходность дела.Для этого он планирует получить кредит и использовать его для покупки породистого бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nusratullo V. is a farmer. He has been raising animals for four years. He buys bull calves, feeds them for 40-45 days, and sells the finished calves at the market. He has a few head of livestock, but wants to use a loan to increase that number. This will allow him to improve the business's profitability. To do this he plans to receive a loan and use it to buy a pure-bred bull calf. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of livestock

loans.name: 30-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.vi:
Chị Bui Thị Hà sinh năm 1946, MS 17.02.0005. Chồng chị đã mất. Chị ở với con trai út. Mạc dù tuổi đã cao nhưng chị không quản khó khăn, mệt nhọc chị đã vay vốn của Quỹ để bán vàng hương. Gia đình chị sống ở phố Nam Ngạn  thành phố Thanh Hoá. Nhóm của chị vay mức 1.626.900 VNĐ. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm :

Chị N. Thị Huyền sinh năm 1978, MS 17.02.0109. Chị vay vốn để mua sắn, ngô ở yên Định về bán lại ở các chợ ở thành phố. Ngoài ra chị còn làm ruộng
Chị Lê Thị Lai sinh năm 1970, MS 17.02.0209. Chị vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng may mặc gia công.
Chị N. Thị Chính, MS 17.02.0208. Chị vay vốn để buôn bán bánh mì.
Chị H. Thị Lâm, MS 17.02.0207. Chị vay vốn để buôn bán gạo và làm ruộng. nuôi gà, lợn
Chị Vũ Thị Vân, MS 17.02.0199, sinh năm 1984. Chị vay vốn để mua Ngô, Sắn ở chợ Yên Định về bán lại ở Thành Phố.
Chị P. Thị Nga, MS 17.02.0198, sinh năm 1984. Chị vay vốn để nuôi gà, lợn và làm ruộng.
texts.en:
Mrs Bui Thị Hà was born in 1946. Her husband passed away. She lives with her youngest son. Despite her age, she's not afraid of obstacles or hard work so she applies for a loan from the fund. She sells imitated golden paper (that would be burned as part of offering to the dead). She lives in the town of Nam Ngạn, Thanh Hoá. Her group members are all requesting a loan of 1.626.900 VND.
  • Mrs N. Thị Huyền, born in 1978. She needs a loan to buy corn & manioc from Yên Định to resell at the markets in the city.
  • Mrs Lê Thị Lai , born in 1970. She needs a loan to invest in her tailor store
  • Mrs N. Thị Chính, she sells bread
  • Mrs H. Thị Lâm, she sells rice, raises pigs & poultry, cultivates in her paddy filed.
  • Mrs Vũ Thị Vân, born in 1984. She needs capital to buy manioc & corn from Yên Định to resell at the markets in the city.
  • Mrs P. Thị Nga, born in 1984. She needs money to raise chickens & pigs. She also cultivates.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: makes religious articles

loans.name: Zubaidullo

texts.ru: Зогов Зубайдулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года, женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей.Имеет торговую точку , где торгует овощами. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 1 год. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, закупить картофель и лук. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zubaidullo Z. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. For the last year Zubaidullo has been selling vegetables at the local market. Currently he wants to take out this loan to finance wholesale purchase of produce, mainly potatoes and onions. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of produce for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build an oven to dry bricks, raises pigs & poultry

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid R. was born in 1968, and is married with one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Agdam region. Vahid is in the Khirdalan settlement.

Ten years ago Vahid started a business. He sells building materials with a truck, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for the truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the truck

loans.name: Mbaye Mactar

texts.fr: Mbaye mactar est agé de 45 ans il est pere de famille et s 'active dans da fabrication de meubles lit armoires et autre meuble de maison depuis plus de dix (10) ans .son atelier est installé dans  sa maison .il est societaire de la caisse depuis 12 mois et a eu à bénéficié de plusieurs prets de la caisse pour le renforcement de son activité.Avec le pret sollicité il va developper son activité en renforçant ses capacités de production par l' achat de quantité importante de bois.
texts.en:
Mbaye Mactar A. is 45 years old and a family man. For more than ten years he has worked as a furniture maker producing beds, wardrobes and other items of household furniture. His workshop is set up in his house. He has been a member of the credit union for 12 months and has benefitted from several loans to strengthen his business. With this requested loan he will develop his business by increasing his production capability through the purchase of a large quantity of wood.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purcahse a large quantity of wood

loans.name: Naziran M.anwar Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Naziran baji is 53 years old; unfortunately, she has been in very poor health for half of her life. Her husband is a woodcutter by profession, but he is currently in the wood-selling business. More specifically, in the past, he would go into the forest to cut wood per requests from his clients; however, he now simply buys wood from a wholeseller and later sells such wood in different places.

Meanwhile, Naziran baji has worked as a seamstress and as a maid over the years. By doing so, she was able to save enough money to help construct their two-room brick house. Naziran baji is now applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood-selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Parveen baji seeks a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business; and Khursheed baji, Yasmeen baji, and Zubaida baji each request a loan to buy clothes to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's wood-selling business by purchasing additional wood

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor S. is 39 years old and makes a living by fishing. She lives in Anlongsamnor Commune in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She has three children; two are students, and one works as a fisherman and contributes to the family’s living expenses. Nhor's husband, Mr. Sophat Un, 43, is also a fisherman. He started fishing in 1979, and he depends on the supply of fish in the Tunle Sap Lake.

Nhor requests a loan of 2,000,000 riel ($500) to purchase fishing equipment for her husband. With better tools, her husband can earn more and be able to provide more food for their children.

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Amir M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Amir baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Amir baji is 27 years old, and she has a 3-year-old daughter. Amir baji’s husband is a driver by profession: specifically, he drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle), and he has been in this line of business for the past 25 years.

Meanwhile, Amir baji herself is a seamstress by trade, but she proudly states that she dutifully performs her duties as both a wife and mother. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he can keep all of his earnings (rather than pay over much of his earnings to the rickshaw's owner). Amir baji is joined in her loan group by three other members: Safia baji seeks a loan to buy leather for her (car) seat-making business; Muniran baji requests a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads and sketches) for her carpet-making business; and Zareena baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To increase her husband's business' profitability by purchasing a rickshaw (rather than continuing to rent a rickshaw)

loans.name: Ok

texts.en: Mrs. Ok E. is a villager in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have much money to hire laborers to harvest the rice. She decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Un Ou, is a construction worker who earns a little income to support the family. Mrs. Ok E. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add new clothing to her inventory.

loans.name: 40- Quãng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
Chị N. Thị Tú, năm nay chị 54 tuổi. Hiện nay chị đang sinh sống tại thôn ba xã Quãng Hưng TP Thanh Hoá. Trước đây 2 con của chị đi học, chồng chị lại không có việc làm, chỉ sống dựa vào hai sào ruộng. Bây giờ gia đình chị đã dần khá lên , chị đã mở được của hàng thú y tại nhà cho chồng chị. Các chu kỳ vay trước chị đã sử dụng vốn vay của Quỹ để mua gà con  và lợn giống  khi làm ăn có lãi nay chị tiếp tục vay mức vốn là 1.626.900 VND để tiếp tục phát triển chăn nuôi và đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng dịch vụ thú y tại nhà                                     
Các thanh viên trong nhóm của chị cùng coa cùng mức vay gồm:
Chị N. Thị M. vay vốn để mua rau muống, rau cải...để bán lại.
Chị N. Thị Chiêu vay vốn để chăn nuôi gà, vịt 
Chị B. Thị Thắm vay vốn để mở rộng cửa hàng may mặc gia công
Chị P. Thị Tình vay vốn để mua phân và rau giống
Chị P. Thị Huyền vay vốn để làm nem chua, một loại thực phẩm đặc sản của Thanh Hoá

loans.use: Phân bón, gà, vịt, thức ăn gia súc, rau ...

loans.name: Parween

texts.en:
Parween lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with 4 children. She works in tailoring and has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. When she started her business it was weak, but after working one year she taught her daughter tailoring and they started working hard and supporting the family better. After a few months they found AFSG and she got her first loan and completed her stock. She is furthering her business and repaying the loan with no difficulty and now she wants anther loan.

She requested an individual loan of 42000 Afghans for the term of 10 months to open a shop near her house to attract more customers, make a good monthly income and provide a better future for her children. She is sure that she can continue her business with this loan process.

Parween is happy with this loan process and wants to thank lenders around the world. She wants to say she would like to continue her partnership in the up-coming years.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Asad

texts.en:
Asad A. was born in 1973. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Gubadli region. Asad is settled in the Absheron region in Masazir village.

Asad has been in business selling boards for 10 years and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy more boards.

loans.use: To buy boards

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. is a villager in Prey Kdouch village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder. As this business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food and ducklings for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with the sales she makes with the help of this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Nop, is a construction worker who earns a low salary. Mrs. Pov K. is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study because they are three months old and three years old. Her husband is presented on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy duck food and ducklings for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan D. is a villager in Rong village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On his plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have seed rice to grow in his field and his field has infertile soil, which has a bad affect on his crop. In order to solve these problems, he decided to request a loan to buy seed rice and fertilizers to enable his field to make his crop more productive. Mr. Phan D. is a 58-year-old widower and the father of two children who are employed in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy seed rice and fertilizers to enable his field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Rani Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is the wife of A. M., and they reside in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. Rani baji is 43 years old, and she is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver (he drives a rented auto-rickshaw, which is a three-wheeled motor vehicle), and her younger son has a food business. As for her daughters, her elder daughter is 8 years old, her younger daughter is 4 years old, and both of them stay at home where they do household work. Rani baji’s husband is also a driver, and he too drives an auto-rickshaw. Further, he has been in this profession for the past 2 years.

Rani baji is a seamstres: she sews the clothes of her neighbors. Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to repair and redesign the body of her husband’s auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members: Sajida baji seeks a loan to buy more wood for her wood-selling business; Gulshan baji requests a loan to buy more clothes to resell; and another Gulshan baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To improve her husband's business by repairing and redesigning the body of his auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn H. is a villager in Leap village in Takeo Province. She is a fish breeder. Her husband, Mr. Nget Met, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In Mrs. Norn H.’s business, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy food to feed her fish; in addition, her husband faces the obstacle of having infertile soil. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Norn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fish food and fertilizers. Her husband is presented on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fish food and fertilizers for her and her husband's buisnesses.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar M.iqbal Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar baji is a 31-year-old, married, extremely active lady. She resides in the city of Borewala in Pakistan, and she is the mother of five children (four boys and one daughter), all of whom are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Naseem baji’s husband name is M., and he is a fruit-seller by profession. More specifically, he buys seasonal fruit from the fruit market at wholesale prices, and later sells such fruit on a cart in his community. Further, he has been selling seasonal fruits for the past 5 years.

Naseem Akhtar baji independently operates a wood-selling business, which she started for the benefit of her children because she wants to provide them with a good education and a good name in their society. Notably, Naseem baji has already successfully repaid one loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more seasonal fruits and seasonal vegetables to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Jamila baji seeks a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop; Hanifan baji requests a loan to buy cosmetics for her cosmetics sales business; Kalsoom baji is in need of a loan to buy electric supplies (e.g., wires and switchboards) for her electric appliance shop; and Shakooran baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's business by purchasing more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurng S. is 20 years old and single. She now lives in Rong village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. On her plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have animals to plow the fields. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her fields. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her fields to make her crop more productive later.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her fields and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sakina M.anwar Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is 40 years old, and she resides in the city of Borewala in Pakistan, where she has lived for the past 13 years. She is married, and she and her husband have six children: four sons and two daughters. Her oldest son sells shoes, her next eldest son runs a grocery store, her next eldest son is a student in the 7th standard, and her youngest son is in the 5th standard. As for her daughters, her elder daughter is in the 10th standard, while her younger daughter is in the 7th standard. Her husband, M., has a wood-selling business. In fact, she points out that he has been selling wood for 25 years.

Sakina baji made a commitment long ago to meet the needs of her children and to ensure that they have a good future. And, to fulfill her commitment to do so, she operates a sewing business; more specifically, she sews clothes for clients in her neighborhood, and she has run this business for the past 10 years. Notably, Sakina baji has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more wood for her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by two other members: another Sakina baji seeks a loan to buy various goods (e.g., lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business; and Amna baji requests a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's wood-selling business by purchasing additional wood

loans.name: Mohammad Hamayoun

texts.en:
Mohammad Hamayoun, who has a contracting company, is married with 2 children. He is a educated man and a very hard worker. He has a building that is located in a good area near the street but he tried many times to build shops and rent them out but he could not. When he found AFSG and asked about this loan process he was really very happy.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 30000 Afghans for the term of 10 months to start building the shops and get them ready to rent in order to make a good profit, repay the loan, and support with his family to provide a better future.

He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for a success loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: To start building shops

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr: Mr D. Gameli est marié et père de quatre enfants. Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins  de sa famille grâce à sa boutique d’alimentation générale qui constitue sa principale source de revenu. Malgré ses efforts, il n’arrive pas à faire évoluer son chiffre et par conséquent son bénéfice. Il sollicite un crédit pour approvisionner sa boutique en divers produits pour la satisfaction d’un plus grand nombre de clients et améliorer ainsi son revenu.
texts.en:
Mr. Gameli D. is married and the father of one child. He manages to provide for his family thanks to his general grocery store, which constitutes his main source of income. In spite of his efforts, he does not succeed in increasing his revenue and, therefore, it profits. He's seeking a loan to supply his shop with various products to meet a larger customer demand and, therefore, increase his revenue.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his grocery store with various products

loans.name: Suraiya Mahandi Hassan Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. H., and they reside in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. They own a two-room, brick house, and they have lived in the house for the past 25 years. Moreover, they have four children: one son and three daughters. Her son has a motorbike rental business, her oldest daughter is a nurse, and her other two daughters make handmade carpets. Her husband has a livestock sales business. Specifically, he sells animals such as buffaloes and goats to earn a profit.

Suraiya baji, meanwhile, helps her daughters make their carpets. In particular, she provides materials (e.g., threads and sketches), which she purchases from the local market. Notably, Suraiya baji has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for another loan for the benefit of her husband's business so that he can buy a buffalo to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members: Haleema baji seeks a loan to buy raw materials (e.g., flour, potatoes, cooking oil, and spices) for her Punjabi food-selling business (she makes samosas and pakodas); Asma baji requests a loan to buy more clothes to resell; and Rubina baji is in need of a loan to buy a decorative embroidery machine to make embroidered dresses. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business by purchasing a buffalo to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloth, decorative window curtains and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling underwear and clothing in the community.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Agé de 22 ans, D. Yao est un jeune homme très dévoué qui se bat beaucoup pour sa réussite. Ayant abandonné ses études faute de moyens financiers, il a embrassé le commerce d'outils champêtre notamment les houes, les dabas etc... qu’il exerce avec passion. Il sollicite ce crédit pour développer son activité et améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Yao D., age 22, is a very devoted young man who works hard towards success. Lacking financial means, he dropped out of school and started a business selling farming tools, most notably hoes. He's very passionate about this activity. He's seeking this loan to bolster his business and increase his revenue.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business of selling farming tools

loans.name: Kokoudavi

texts.fr: Vivant actuellement dans le village, K. Kokoudavi est marié et père de trois enfants. Il fait le commerce des houes avec lesquelles les paysans labourent les champs. Il est agriculteur lui-même. Afin d’aider ces confrères dans leurs activités, il veut stocker des houes qui ne coûtent pas grand-chose en saison sèche et les revendre en saison des pluies où les houes coûtent extrêmement chères. Ce qui lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfices et ainsi améliorer la situation actuelle de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Currently living in the village, Kokoudavi K. is married and the father of three children. He sells hoes that the peasants use in the fields. He is a farmer himself. In order to help his fellow workers, he wants to stock up on hoes during the dry season when they are not expensive and sell them during the rainy season when hoes are extremely expensive. This will enable him to make a greater profit and improve his family’s current situation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of agricultural tools

loans.name: Comlan Etsè

texts.fr: Marié et père de quatre enfants, Mr D. Comlan Etsè vit dans le village d’Amegnran et est menuisier. Malgré sa bonne volonté, son courage et son expérience dans la profession, il n’arrive pas à faire sortir sa famille de la misère et à faire développer son atelier faute de moyens financiers. Il sollicite ce crédit pour faire une commande de planche afin de faire des meubles pour les revendre et ainsi faire face aussi aux commandes de clients qui ne manquent pas. Ceci lui permettra d'améliorer ainsi la situation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and a father of four, Mr. Comlan Etsè D. is a cabinet-maker who lives in the village of Amegnran. Despite his good intentions, courage, and experience in his trade, he has not managed to raise his family out of poverty or to improve his workshop due to a lack of financial means. He is requesting this loan to order lumber, so that he can make furniture to sell. Thus, he can also fill customer orders, which are not lacking. This will enable him to improve his family's situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pumber to make and sell furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling tablecloths, window curtains and similar goods.

loans.name: Ndeye Khady

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans ndeye khady D. est une femme mariée mere de trois enfants (02).Elle  s'active dans la vente de tissus chaussures depuis deux ans .La marchandise est vendu  à crédit aux du quartier.chaque jour elle fait le tour des maisons du quartier pour collecter les avances des clients qui payent quotidiennement .son experience avec la caisse date de plus de 9 mois au cours desquelle elle a eu à bénéficier d 'un premier pret dans le cadre de ses activités.Les fetes de fin d 'année constituant une periode de forte de demende en tissus ,pour satisfaire à la demende elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
31-year-old Ndeye Khady D. is married and the mother of three children. She has been selling fabric and shoes for two years. The merchandise is sold on credit within her neighborhood. Every day she calls on houses in the neighborhood to collect advances from customers who pay daily. She has been involved with the Fund for more than nine months, during which time she received an initial loan to help her business. Fabric is in high demand during the holiday season. To satisfy requirements, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr: Née à Kpélé-Elé, Madame Y. Délali est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle vit actuellement avec son Mari à Afagnan. La préparation et la vente de produits alimentaires (bouillie et beignets) est son activité. Elle sollicite ce financement pour constituer un stock de mais afin d'augmenter sa capacité de vente. De l’exploitation, elle tirera  des revenus suffisants pour améliorer l’existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Kpélé-Elé, Ms. Délali Y. is married and the mother of six. She currently lives with her husband in Afagnan. Her work involves making and selling food (porridge and doughnuts). The financing she is requesting would be used for building a stock of corn in order to increase her sales capacity. Through the use of the loan, she will derive an income large enough to improve her family's life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock of corn mais for making and selling porridge

loans.name: Azimkul

texts.en: G. Azimkul owns a farm where he grows wheat and potatoes. He uses the land to feed his family, and he and his wife work their fields everyday, hoping for a good crop. He is proud of his farm because it has allowed him to care for and educate his children. He has applied for a loan of $600 for 11 months to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and help prepare his land for the next crop. G. was born and raised in Shahristan, but hopes his children can gain an education and move to a bigger city. His main short-term goal is to make all the lands he owns productive, as certain parts of it have not been prepared for farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Née à Kouvé, Yvette K. est marié et vit actuellement avec son mari qui est instituteur et leurs enfants. En dehors de leurs cinq enfants ils ont encore quatre personnes à charges. Pour aider son mari à faire face aux besoins de la famille, elle a ouvert une boutique dans le village dans laquelle elle vend des produits de premières nécessités. Malgré ses efforts elle n’arrive pas à ravitailler la boutique comme cela se doit. Alors elle sollicite ce crédit pour répondre à la demande des clients de plus en plus croissant. Ceci lui permettra de dégager des revenus suffisants et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Kouvé, Yvette K. is married and currently lives with her husband, a schoolteacher, and their children. In addition to their five children, they have four persons to support. To help her husband in providing for the family, she opened a small shop in the village, where she sells staples. In spite of her efforts, she does not manage to correctly supply her store. She's therefore seeking this loan to meet an ever increasing customer demand. This will enable her to turn a profit and provide for her family needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her staples store

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
G. Abdujabbor has worked on his farm for his entire life, and now lives there with his wife and three children. He relies completely on his crop of potatoes and vegetables to feed his family, because those are the only things that will grow on his land. 

Abdujabbor was born and raised in Shahristan and learned to farm vegetables from his father. Today, his children help him with his business. Because he has a large family, Abdujabbor has applied for a loan of $600 to help buy fertilizer and sacks in which to store his crop. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can help change his life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato sacks

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.en:
Khayrullo is married and has four children. He keeps his family together through dedication and lots of hard work as a farmer. He has worked in this area for the past 10 years, and has gained much knowledge and skill in the cultivation of wheat, corn, potatoes and other crops. Because he is a totally dedicated to his work, he spends most of his time on his farm, which demands total commitment. 

Khayrullo has applied for a loan of $600 for nine months to buy more supplies, especially seeds and mineral fertilizer. This loan will allow him to earn more money and educate all of his children. Khayrullo has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006, and his credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. Please consider helping increase the well-being of this hard-working young man and his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en: M. Bakhtiyor has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He works even harder at it now because he has made a home with his beautiful wife and their four lovely children, all of whom he loves very much. Due to his high level of knowledge, he takes full advantage of his land, leaving parcels fallow sometimes so that the land will grow excellent products for him. He is applying for a loan of $600 for 11 months to buy seeds and  fertilizer for his crops, mostly wheat and potatoes, and to restore some of his parcels by leaving them fallow. Bakhtiyor feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that his children can stay in school and have a bright future. Please consider supporting this husband and father, who has so much strength and courage.

loans.use: To buy seeds fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medical instruments, a microscope, a refrigerator, and a TV for the waiting room.

loans.name: Loko

texts.fr: Z. Loko  est né en 1975 à Ahoulogoè où il fait la culture maraichère depuis 16 ans. C'est une activité dans laquelle il excelle et qui lui procure des revenus. Par manque de moyens financiers et pour augmenter sa surface cultivable, il sollicite ce crédit pour mener à bien son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Loko Z. was born in 1975 in Ahoulogoè, where he has been doing market gardening for sixteen years. This is a business in which he excels and which brings in an income. Due to a lack of financial means and to increase his arable land, he is requesting this loan to do his work well.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his cultivable area for market gardening

loans.name: Kuzi

texts.en: R. Kuzi is 44 years old and married. He and his wife of 12 years have five beautiful children. In addition to going to school, the two older children help Kuzi with his daily work, which consists of growing crops such as onions, potatoes and wheat. He has been in this line of work for 12 years, and has been helped for that entire time by his wife. Now, he has applied for a loan of $600 to buy seeds and fertilizer, which will allow the family to increase its output. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months, and thanks Kiva for the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.en: S. Tavakal always feels great satisfaction when people enjoy his delicious fruits and vegetables, since he puts enormous effort into growing them. He possesses beautiful land where he grows his crops in the company of his family, which is the reason why he works the way he does. He is proud of his farm because it has allowed him to feed and educate his children. Tavakal is aware of the needs of his family, and for this reason wants to open a grocery store in his house, so that this new business can cover part of the family’s daily expenses. In order to achieve this wish, he is seeking a loan to increase his production of wheat and potatoes. Please consider supporting Tavakal’s goal of improving his life and the life of his wife and family members.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.en:
S. Gaybullo is 50 years old, married and the loving father of two children. He makes his living as a farmer, and is both a strong and spiritual man. He plows his land to the best of his abilities. Thanks to his energy and high spirits, he has been able to support his family for 26 years and to offer them an education as well. Gaybullo sows potatoes, onions, carrots and wheat. Each year he grows enough crops for his family and to sell to others. Gaybullo also raises cattle, buying them on the open market at a low price, and then fattening them up for resale at a higher price.

Gaybullo is preparing for the day when his children are older and his expenses are higher. That is why he is applying for a loan of $750 for nine months to buy seeds and fertilizer. Gaybullo thanks everyone who trusts and supports him, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. With your help, it will be possible for him to grow his business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Mamissi, Madame Akoélé A. habite actuellement Ahoulogoè avec sa famille. Depuis 16 ans, elle exerce le commerce de l’huile de palme qu’elle produit elle-même. C’est une dame très active mais faute de moyens suffisants n’arrive pas sortir de la misère. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour développer son activité et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Mamissi, Ms. Akoélé A. currently lives in Ahoulogoè with her family. For sixteen years, she has been doing commerce in palm oil, which she produces herself. She is a woman who is very active but, due to a lack of sufficient funds, isn't managing to escape poverty. She is requesting this loan to develop her business and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make palm oil

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: G. Mutabar has always been around farming and farmers. Ten years ago, she decided to grow her own crop of potatoes and onions. After several years of doing this, she and her husband established a family. Now they are surrounded by five children and several grandchildren, and want only to provide the best for all them. To make the most of their farming, they have always sold their products wholesale. Today, however, G. and her husband are thinking of starting to raise and sell animals. They hope to go into this business with the profits from their next harvest. To make this possible, they have applied for a loan of $750 for 12 months to invest in the seeds and fertilizer they need to improve the size of their crop and the quality of their produce. Please help this couple improve the lives of their children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce Y. sells frozen meat and chicken. She is married and has three children. Her husband works with the Ghana water company.

Joyce received primary education and has been selling frozen meat and chicken for eight years. She is responsible for paying the utility bills in her house.

Joyce will use her loan to increase her sales of frozen meat. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To increase her sales of frozen meat.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Né le 27/07/1968 à Vogan, Mr T. Amévi est marié et père de cinq enfants. Il arrive à supporter les charges de sa famille grâce à sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et faire face à la demande des clients qui ne cesse d’augmenter et mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il sollicite ce crédit sur lequel il compte beaucoup.
texts.en:
Born on July 27, 1968 in Vogan, Mr. Amévi T. is married and the father of five. He's managing to support his family thanks to his grocery store. To increase his working capital, to address the ever-growing customer demand, and to provide for his family better, he is requesting this loan that he is counting on a lot.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop with goods

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de six enfants, Mme M. Amélé est née le 15/01/1971 à Anfoin. Très reconnu dans la restauration à causse de sa spécialité qui est la pâte de maïs appelé KOM. Ce travail qu’elle fait avec enthousiasme et les règles d’hygiène qui l'accompagnent lui procure de quoi subvenir aux besoins de sa grande famille. Soucieuse de la responsabilité qui lui incombe à savoir l’éducation de ces enfants, elle sollicite ce crédit pour constituer un stock suffisant de maïs afin de développer son activité et sortir sa famille de la misère.
texts.en:
Ms. Amélé M. was born on January 15, 1971 in Anfoin. She is married and the mother of six and is renown for her catering because of her speciality, which is called "kom" (similar to polenta made from cornmeal). This work, that she performs with enthusiasm and according to the rules of hygiene that go along with it, has gotten her the wherewithal to provide for her large family. Concerned about the responsibility that is incumbent upon her, namely the education of these children, she is requesting this loan to create a stock of corn sufficient enough to develop her business and to raise her family out of poverty.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on corn for catering

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. prepares rice and sauce for sale to her costumers who are too busy to cook. She lives in Kakumdo, near the Cape Coast. Esther received a primary school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an electrician.

Esther has been preparing rice and sauce for sale for six years. She is responsible for paying school fees, and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and other ingredients. This will enable her to increase production. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and other ingredients to increase production.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Vogan, madame A. Abla est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse de profession mais cette activité ne marche pas très bien. Malgré ses efforts, elle n’arrive pas à sortir de la misère à cause du manque du moyen financier. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite ce crédit pour pour coupler à son activité de coiffeuse la vente de produits cosmétiques afin de faire face aux demandes de ses clients qui ne cessent d’augmenter. Ce financement augmentera certainement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in Vogan, in 1977, Mrs Abla A. is married and has one child. She is a hair dresser by profession, but this business has not been going too well. In spite of her efforts she has been unable too rise above the problem of lack of financing. For this reason she is requesting a loan to increase her business activities to include the sale of cosmetic products to meet the needs of her ever increasing clientele. This financing will certainly increase her revenues.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products in her beauty salon

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Lomé, Madame A. Pauline est veuve avec trois enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires (condiments et légumes frais) qui lui procurent le minimum vital pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Prenant à cœur son commerce elle sollicite ce crédit pour développer son commerce, augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et faire plus de bénéfices et faire face à l’éducation de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Lomé, Mrs. Pauline A. is a widow with three children. She sells food products (condiments and fresh vegetables), which furnishes her the living wage she needs to provide for her children. Taking her business to heart, she's seeking this loan to expand it, in order to increase her revenue and her profits, to provide for her children's education.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Afito

texts.fr: Veuve  avec trois personnes à charges, madame Afito A. est née en 1955à Dagué. Elle est populaire dans le village à cause de son dynamisme et de son activité vente de médicaments génériques dans la pharmacie du village. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour approvisionner sa pharmacie en produits pour le bonheur des habitants du village et aussi pour sa propre survie car c’est cette activité qui la fait vivre et fait nourrir les personnes dont elle a la charge et surtout d’assurer la scolarité de ces enfants.
texts.en:
A widow with three people in her care, Ms. Afito A. was born in 1955 in Dagué. She is popular in her village because of her dynamism and her work selling generic medicines in the village pharmacy. She is requesting this loan to supply the pharmacy for the village inhabitants and their happiness and also for her own survival, since it is from this work that she makes a living and feeds those in her care. It also ensures the schooling of these children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell generic medicines

loans.name: Dajana

texts.en: Dajana was born in 1987 and she lives in Doboj, a town in Bosnia.  At 21, she is unmarried and lives with her parents and sister.  She works as a financial analyst at the local train station, but she earns only 450KM/month, the equivalent of roughly $300 USD/month.  To supplement her income, Dajana sells cosmetics and offers manicures from inside her home.  She requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women, International, with which she will buy supplies and equipment to offer more upscale manicures.  She hopes that the investment will show that her business is professional, and will attract more clients.  She does not want to run a beauty shop for the rest of her life, but says that this is a necessary business for her to support herself in the short term.

loans.use: To buy manicure supplies.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Kpémé, madame Adakou A. est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas exercer correctement son commerce et à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. En vue d’améliorer son revenu et de faire face à la demande de ces clients, elle sollicite ce crédit pour développer son commerce et faire plus de  revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et celles de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Kpémé, Togo, Madame Adakou A. is married and has four children. She sells groceries. Despite her best efforts, she is not able to run her business at a satisfactory level and cover her children’s needs. With a view to increasing her income and meeting the demands of her clients, she is requesting this loan to develop her business, top up her income and raise the living standards of her children and her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Ljubinka

texts.en:
Ljubinka was born in 1978 and she lives in a suburb of Doboj, Bosnia. She is married and has 3 children: 2 boys and 1 girl.  Her husband is self-employed and re-sells used cars. To help support her family, Ljubinka raises chickens and sells their meat to local factories. 

Ljubinka is requesting a loan of 1,200KM ($800 USD) from Women for Women International, with which she will buy baby chickens and chicken food. By expanding her poultry business, Ljubinka hopes to earn additional income and to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken food
