loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, A. Ablavi est une femme courageuse qui se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle fait le commerce des chaussures et sacs pour femmes depuis trois ans. Ce commerce procure un peu de revenu pour venir en aide à son mari pour la prise en charge du foyer. Pour développer son activité et avoir plus de revenu, elle sollicite ce crédit.
texts.en:
38-year-old Ablavi A. is a courageous woman who works towards her children future success. Married and the mother of three children, for the past three years she has traded in shoes and ladies’ handbags. This business has brought in a little income to assist her husband in supporting the household. Abavi is requesting this loan to expand her business and to bring in more income.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of shoes and ladies' handbags

loans.name: Adoté

texts.fr: Marié et père de deux enfants, Adoté A. est coiffeur de profession. Il est connu dans le village pour le fait qu’il est très expérimenté dans l’art de coiffer. Mais malheureusement ses matériels de travail sont très  vétustes, ce  qui ne lui permet pas d’exercer son métier dans les conditions normales. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit pour renouveler ses outils de travail afin de faire plus de revenus et récupérer ses clients qui ne sont plus au rendez-vous ces derniers temps le laissant dans la misère, dans de conditions de vies très pénibles.
texts.en:
Married and the father of two children, Adoté A. is a barber by trade. He is known throughout the village for his expertise in the art of barbering; unfortunately, however, his work implements are so old that they do no permit him to practice his profession as it should be done. To rectify this, he is requesting a loan to refurbish his equipment with the goal of increasing his income and attracting back the customers that have not returned of late, leaving him in abject poverty and dire straits.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Mr DJIBY T. est agé de plus de quarante (40) années , il est marié et pere de plusieurs enfants  .Il exerce depuis plusieures années le metier de tailleur il forme aussi des jeunes au metier de tailleur.l 'achat de fils,bouton,tissus et autres accessoires entraine des depenses importantes sa part et reduise ainsi ses marges beneficieres pour parrer à ça ,il sollicite un pret a fin de constituer un stock important de ces accessoires
texts.en:
Mr. DJIBY T. is over 40 years old, married, and the father of several children. For many years, he has been working as a tailor, and he also trains young people in his trade. Buying thread, buttons, cloth, and other supplies amounts to sizable expenses for him and therefore reduces his profit margin. To fend off this concern, he is requesting a loan to build up a healthy stock of these supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Agé de 45 ans Mr K. Kossi est un père de famille. Il vit avec sa femme et leurs sept enfants. Mécanicien de profession, cette activité ne lui permet plus de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est pour cela qu’il fait aussi le commerce des pièces détachées pour pouvoir joindre les deux bouts. C’est un commerce de gros. Afin d’augmenter le nombre des pièces à vendre dans la boutique, il sollicite ce crédit pour diversifier les pièces à commander et faire plus de bénéfice afin d’améliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kosi K., aged 45, is a family man. He lives with his wife and their seven children. Mr. K. was unable to provide for his family as a mechanic by trade, so he had to start selling spare parts in order to make ends meet. This job requires large quantities of parts. He is requesting this loan so he can order more parts to sell in his shop and thus increase his profit, allowing him to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and selling of spare car parts

loans.name: Esinat E.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Esinat M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, aged between 10 and 19. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because their parents died of HIV.

Esinat has been running a crops selling business since 1993. Her business is buying crops from farmers and selling them in town at higher prices. She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her daughter. Currently she earns about $180 from her business.

She is requesting a loan of $750 in order to purchase additional stocks of crops such as rice, maize, and beans. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Esinat thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops such as rice, maize, and beans

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est âgée de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalime, une ville à 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Les besoins des clients devenant de plus en plus exigeants, Komi souhaite alimenter sa boutique afin de répondre à leur exigence. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits qui, lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A. is 45 years old, married and the father of three children. He runs a small general store in Kpalime, a town situated 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With customers becoming ever more demanding, Komi would like to increase the range of his stock in order to better meet their requirements. He is counting on this opportunity to increase sales and consequently his profit so that he can better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Mwajabu's Group

texts.en: B. Mwajabu is the leader of Twisakirala women’s group in Jinja.  She is a married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school.  She cares for two orphaned relatives.  Mwajabu has a retail shop business in Jinja that has been operational for five years although she has been in her lending group for four years.  She is grateful for the loans from Pearl Microfinace because they have been able to transform her shop to its current state where she can make reasonable profits.  She was limited before because she had little to sell in the shop.  Mwajabu needs a loan to be able to buy more products for her shop so that in the future she can transform it into a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Car parts to repair taxi

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is 54 years old and married with 8 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods at new Benin market and has 2 girls assist her. Currently, Blessing purchases her cooking ingredients on credit, which she pays back after selling her food.  Her profit margin is reduced since she buys on credit and pays interest. She hopes to purchase more food items to cook and sell and is requesting a loan of N100, 000. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Giegbefu

texts.en: Giegbefu A. is 28 years old and married without children. He sells bags of cement to build houses. His shop is strategically located in a busy area in Benin City, which has boosted his business. He is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425) to purchase more bags of cement to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca O. is 60 years old and married with 9 children. She sells drinks and food items such as fufu, which is made from soaked cassava.  She wants to increase her sales and is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425) to purchase more food items to sell. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's Groupa

texts.en: N. Ruth is a member of Tweyambe women’s group A in Jinja.  She is a single mother of 5 children and cares for 2 orphans belonging to her younger sister.  Ruth has a business of selling used clothing in Jinja, mostly by going to daily markets locally known as ‘mubuulo’.  Such markets are good for her type of business because customers are always ready to buy since such markets keep on rotating in places where there is almost no access to any other markets.  Ruth buys her clothes from both Kampala and Jinja, depending on where the purchase prices are favorable for increased profits.  She would like another loan to help with buying more clothes for her stock in preparation for the festive season in December.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for retail.

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's Groupb

texts.en: Eva N. is the leader of Subgroup B in the Tweyambe group. She also has a business of selling used clothes in and around the daily markets in Jinja.  Her range of clothing types include ladies', children's and men’s wear of all kinds, and this diversification has helped her in attracting more customers to her business.  In the photo, Eva is with Harriet K. and Lovinsa D..  They all need loans to boost their businesses just like Eva needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for retail.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace U. is 60 years old and married with 6 children. She sells yams and food items like garri, made from cassava. She purchases yams from the north, a 13 hours drive from Benin City, Nigeria. With the holiday season approaching she expects an increased demand for her yams and plans to increase her stock. She is requesting a loan for N50,000 ($425) to purchase more yams to sell. She is happy for this opportunity because her profits will increase. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Groupa

texts.en: Nimba N. is a very hard working lady with a business selling used clothes in the daily markets in Jinja.  She is a member of Balitwegomba women’s group and is a single lady, but she decided to join this trade to be able to cater for her children, especially to pay school fees to give them a brighter future.  She has hope that with their education, and after getting decent jobs, they will be able to cater for her during her old age.  Nimba has customers in all markets.  She goes to Kampala once or twice a week to buy a bale or two of clothes.  These days she has even started to buy from Jinja, and this saves on the transport costs.

loans.use: To buy clothes for retail.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory O. built a small room, added chairs and installed DSTV for football (soccer) fans without access to TV. She named her place Sport Plaza, an indoor space for football enthusiasts to watch matches on TV. She charges a small fee (approx 43 cents) per game. She also has a store at the Sport Plaza entrance selling drinks to customers. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425) to purchase more drinks and increase the number of plastic chairs. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and plastic chairs

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: SU FAMILIA SE CONSTITUYE DE CUATRO MIEMBROS , ESPOSO -ESPOSA Y SUS DOS HIJAS. LA  SRA. DEMETRIA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE COMERCIO DE FRUTAS DE TEMPORADA POR OTRA PARTE SU CONYUGUE SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE TRANSPORTE. LA COMPETENCIA ES ALTA DEBIDO A QUE EXISTEN UN NUMERO CONSIDERABLE DE COMERCIANTES Y DE TRANSPORTISTAS. EL PRESENTE CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRAR UN PEQUEÑO TERRENO. CLIENTE CON MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO MANTIENE CERO DIAS DE MORA EN SU ANTERIOR OPERACION. SE HACE NOTAR QUE VARIAS VECES SE FUE A TOMAR LA FOTO A DOÑA DEMETRIA PERO NO SE LA PUDO ENCONTRAR POR LO QUE ESTA VEZ SE TOMO FOTOGRAFÍA DE SU CASA Y A SUS DOS HIJITAS.
texts.en:
Mrs. Demetria works in the seasonal fruit business. She is married and has two kids (two girls). Her husband works in the transportation business. Competition is high, since there are numerous people that either work in transportation or selling fruit. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a small parcel of land. She is a client with good credit and no delays in paying her previous loan. Several times it was tried to take her picture but she was not available so the picture available is of her two daughters and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parcel of land.

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Groupb

texts.en: Juliet M. is the leader of Balitwegomba women’s group in Jinja.  "Balitwegomba" means "they will admire us," and in this case, these ladies hard work with their business skills and management, and the sky is the limit for their prosperity.  Juliet is a humble lady with a retail shop that she has owned for over 3 years now.  This is her second loan with the group, and her aim is to transform her shop into a more profitable one by using the loan to buy more products for the shop for increased profitability.  Juliet is married with 5 children, as she cares for 2 orphaned children belonging to her late brother.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. sells charcoal, which is a source of fuel to those who can not afford to buy gas. Agnes received no formal education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a butcher.

Agnes has been selling charcoal for quite a long time now. She is responsible for paying the housekeeping expenses and other utility bills. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy more charcoal in bags for resale in smaller quantities to her customers.

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land on which she plan to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal in bags for resale in smaller quantities.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy N. is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs, bags, and second hand clothing. With Christmas and New Year's fast approaching, she expects a higher demand for her products. She hopes to purchase more items to sell during the holidays and is happy because her sales will increase.  She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 ($425) to purchase more sarongs, second hand shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, second hand bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Kokumo

texts.en:
Kokumo A. is 28 years old and married with a child.  She owns a phone booth where she sells phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  

She is requesting the loan amount of $425 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support, and LAPO microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of various ingredients to produce empanadas.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing A. is 25 years old. She is married with a child and she is presently expecting another child.

Blessing has a business selling second-hand clothes. The demands from customers for her second-hand clothes are high. She travels to Contonou to purchase used clothes to sell in Benin City.

She is now requesting a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more clothes to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Gisela is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 22 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. They live with her in-laws in the Quinuapata neighborhood.

Gisela runs a small bar at the house, where she sells beer and soda during the day and food at night. The menu includes such foods as salchipapas (French fries with hot dog slices), fried fish, and chicken with rice. Her husband helps her with the business in his free time. Gisela needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beer and soda. She dreams of having a bigger business, and for her children to study and grow up to be better off than her. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Gisela es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. Gisela es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Gisela vive en la casa de sus suegros en el Barrio de Quinuapata, en donde tiene un pequeño bar, durante el día vende cervezas, gaseosas y por las noches vende comida como salchipapas, pescado frito, arroz con pollo, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en su tiempo libre. Gisela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas. Gisela sueña con tener un negocio mas grande, sus hijos estudien y sean mejores que ella.

loans.use: Buy beer and soda

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. is 30 years old. She is married but does not have any children.

For a living, she sells provisions and foodstuffs. She also sells pure water and drinks. She combined these businesses together to enable her to support her husband and help meet the family expenses.

She now needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing N. is 40 years old. She is married and she has six children.

To earn a living, Blessing sells provisions - wholesale and retail - to her customers. She sells goods like toothpaste, soap, and detergents. The demands for her provisions are high.

Her children assist her in her business when they come home from school each day.

Blessing is requesting a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. sells a local meal made out of corn that is popularly known as "kenkey." It is one of the most commonly eaten meals in the country and is normally eaten with fried fish in Kakumdo (near Cape Coast).

Comfort has received no formal education. She is married and has five dependents. She is responsible for paying for house keeping expenses and other utility bills.

Comfort has been selling kenkey for eight years. Her loan will be used to purchase more maize, which she uses to prepare the kenkey, fresh fish, and other ingredients. This will enable her increase her production of the food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into his business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel O. is a 42-year-old, single man. He lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria.

To earn a living, he is in the printing business; more specifically, he uses his printer to print designs for his customers. Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of N70,000 ($600) to purchase a second-hand computer for designing purposes. By doing so, he will be able to reduce his costs because he is currently completing his design jobs elsewhere. In turn, he firmly believes that he will generate an increase in his profits. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for design purposes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more underwear to her stock and move her business forward.

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
I. Sheriff is 34 years old and married with 4 children.  She sells drinks in crates.  She is happy because the demand for her drinks will be high during the festive season.  She hopes to increase the stock in her shop during this season.  

She is requesting the loan amount of $425 to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is 36 years old and married with a child.  She sells provisions and drinks.  She also sells pepper soup (a soup made of pepper, seasonings, meat or fresh fish and other local spices).  

She is requesting the loan amount of $425 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. sells fabrics, men’s shoes, and towels. Grace received a junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a security man.

Grace has been in her business since 1998. She is responsible for paying for the housekeeping expenses, the children's school fees, and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy increased inventory of the fabrics, shoes, and the towels she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land on which she plans to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy fabric, shoes, and towels for resale.

loans.name: Brigida's Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to add to her inventory; and toys for the Christmas period.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. sells bread that she bakes herself. She also sells gari and groundnuts. Edith is a single parent with three children. She received no formal education. She is solely responsible for caring for her children and paying for utility bills.

Edith has been in her business since 2002. Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for the baking of the bread and also to increase her inventory of gari and groundnuts. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house that she wants to build for her family.

loans.use: To buy flour and other baking ingredients and increase her inventory of gari and groundnuts.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the Proyección Village Bank.  She is 40 years old and married with five children. 

Alejandra sells sweets from a tricycle cart, which she usually stations outside of a local school or at the inter-provincial transport agency. She works every day along with her 12-year-old daughter, who goes to school in the afternoons. Alejandra also buys and sells prickly pears at the Ayacucho bus station.   

Alejandra needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cookies, candies, prickly pears and boxes to transport them in. Her dreams are for her children to go to school, to have her own investment capital, and to improve and expand her business.



Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección. 
Alejandra es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Alejandra vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, diariamente se ubica cerca de un colegio y una agencia de transporte interprovincial, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de su hija de 12 años, que estudia por las tardes. Además Alejandra en temporadas de cosecha compra y vende tuna en el terminal terrestre. 
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, cajones para tuna y tuna.

Los sueños de Alejandra son que sus hijos estudien, tener capital propio y mejorar, ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cookies, candies, prickly pears and boxes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to produce 'pica pollo'.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria R. tiene la edad de 59 años habita en el sector de San José ríos ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo y hijos, el marido de la señora trabaja como transportista y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa al igual que sus hijas trabajan como meseras en un restaurante y aporta para los gastos de casa, esta señora es comerciante y a la vez se dedica a la agricultura  desde hace 30 años la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es falta de financiamiento por lo cual no a sacado una producción muy buena por falta de insumos , los sueños de doña Maria es llegar a expandir sus cultivos para ayudarles a sus hijas con la universidad y verla en un futuro mejor , ya que ella por problemas económico no siguió estudiando. La señora solicita un monto de C$ 4,000.00 córdobas para terminar de darle mantenimiento a su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria R. is 59 years old and lives in the San José rivers sector of Ticuantepe municipality with her husband and children. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps with the household expenses and her daughters work as waitresses in a restaurant and support the household expenses. Maria is a vendor and has farmed for 30 years. Her greatest difficulty is the lack of financing so she didn’t have a good harvest for lack of supplies. Maria dreams of expanding her crops in order to help her daughters attend the university and have a better future, because she, for economic problems, didn’t continue her own education. She is seeking a loan for C$4,000.00 to finish providing maintenance to her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, herbicides and seeds for her crops

loans.name: Blanca Julia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Julia Juárez  tiene  la  edad de 38 años, su estado civil es soltera , tiene 2 hijos un varón de la edad de 23 años quien no esta laborando actualmente y una mujer de 18 años de edad que cursa el 5 año de bachillerato, en sus sueños esta mantener activo su negocio, por lo que ella desea acondicionar su establecimiento siendo este a la ves su vivienda  por  lo que es necesario acondicionar para que ambos representen un lugar donde vivir y un establecimiento, en sus  propósitos esta  lograr que su hija se reciba de 5 año de secundaria por lo que este ha sido un sacrificio que ha hecho por medio de su trabajo para que su hija logre tener un futuro en los estudios ya que para Doña Blanca este seria un gran orgullo.


Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en la 3 calle del Bo. San jerónimo, el tiempo que tiene de tener su negocio es de 7 años, ella inicia por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo que le proporcionara ingresos para mantener a su familia y por iniciativa propia decide realizar la venta de tortillas al principio inicio con una determinada cantidad de tortillas pero al ver que esta le proporcionaba afluencia de clientes decidió invertir mas en este negocio, por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo   ya que ella necesita efectuar la compra de leña por que esta es una de las materias primas que mas utiliza y consume a diario y además de la compra de la leña esta la compra del maíz que se utiliza para la realización del producto como es la tortilla por lo que son necesarios para poder fabricar su producto por lo que decide recurrir a la Fundación León 2000 y a las diferentes organizaciones que le tendieron esta mano amiga.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca Nubia Julia Juárez is 38 years old, single, and has 2 children—a 23-year-old son who is currently unemployed and an 18-year-old daughter who is in her fifth year of high school. Ms. Juárez dreams of keeping her business active, which is why she wants to fit out her place of business, which is also her house, so it is necessary to refurbish it because they represent both a home and a business. One of her goals is for her daughter to finish high school, which has been a sacrifice that she has made via her business so that her daughter can pursue higher education. This would give Ms. Blanca so much pride. She sells tortillas in her business, which is inside her house, located on 3 calle del Bo. San Jerónimo. She has been running this business for 7 years. She started the business out of the need to look for a job that provided her with income so that she could support her family. Through her own initiative, she decided to sell tortillas for a living. At first, she started out with an predetermined amount of tortillas, but upon seeing that this gave her an influx of customers, she decided to invest more into her business. This loan is for work capital since she needs to purchase firewood, one of her most utilized supplies. She also wants to purchase corn, which she uses for making her tortillas. For this reason, she turns to Fundación León 2000 and to the different organizations that have given her a helping hand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La  Jacqueline  tiene la  edad 32 años habita en el sector de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo de la señora trabaja como comerciante y agricultor  desde hace 15 años para ayudarle con los gastos de casa al igual su marido. La mayor problemática es no tener ningún apoyo con instituciones lo cual los cultivos carecen de insumos y los resultados no son los esperados. Esta señora solicita el monto C$ 7,000.00 córdobas para compra de insumos y así poder tener mejor producción, venderían a mejor precio y le darían una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old and lives with her husband and sons in an area close to several rivers in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works with her husband, who is a farmer and merchant since 15 years, in order to help with the house expenses. However, their biggest problem is that they do not receive any type of support from external institutions. Therefore, their crops do not get the necessary agricultural supplies and yield a meager harvest (in terms of quality and quantity). That is why Mrs Jacqueline requests C$ 7,000.00 to buy agricultural supplies (such as fertilizers and pesticides) in order improve the harvest and sell it at a higher price. This will improve their revenues and give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Blopo

texts.fr:
Madame K. Blopo est née le 13 mars 1967 à Lomé.  Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité la vente de poissons fumés dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1997 et est bien expérimenté dans ce domaine de vente de poissons. Au cours de l’année 2000 elle a ajouté la vente de volailles (pintades) qui lui rapporte beaucoup de revenus.
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter 25 paniers de poissons fumés et 60 pintades afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients durant la période des fêtes de fin d’année et gagner de bon revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Blopo K. was born on March 13, 1967 in Lomé. She is married and a mother of one child. Her work involves selling smoked fish in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. She started this business in 1997 and is highly experienced in the domain of fishmongering. During 2000, she included the sale of poultry (Guinea hens), and it brings in a lot of income for her. She once was a recipient of a loan, which she repaid. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 25 baskets of smoked fish and 60 Guinea hens in order to satisfy her customers during the year-end holiday period and to earn a good income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish and Guinea hens

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Olivia tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos de 12 y14 años de edad, los dos están estudiando la secundaria en el colegio del barrio madre soltera, ha puro esfuerzo logro poner una pequeña pulpería que la tiene desde hace diez años, solo comenzó vendiendo refrescos, y frutas, y por falta de financiamiento es que su pulpería no ha tenido el crecimiento en capital, pues comenzó con capital propio, ahora esta optando por prestamos en Afodenic para invertir en la compra de productos para su pulpería como pollo, granos básicos y frutas para ofertar a sus clientela espera beneficiarse para crecer y a largo plazo  poder crear nuevos nichos de mercados, a si como ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. She has two children ages 12 and 14 who study in the neighborhood secondary school. A single mother, she was able to open a small grocery store 10 years ago, beginning with selling refreshments and fruit. Because of a lack of financing her convenience store hasn’t grown as she started with just her own savings. Now she is opting for loans from Afodenic to invest in buying products for her store such as chicken, basic grains and fruit to offer her customers in hopes of growing her business and in the long term to create new markets and in this way help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, vegetables, and fruit

loans.name: Señor  De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal denominado  SEÑOR D. MAYO, esta conformado por señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Ciudad D. El Alto. 
La directiva esta conformada por las Sras. Patricia, Lizbeth y Graciela;  Los integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como ser: condimentos, conservas, lácteos, material escolar, chocolates y otros. Las socia en su mayoría saben del trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que no es el primer financiamiento que se les otorga como grupo, con la experiencia D. anteriores ciclos saben D. la responsabilidad que implica el financiamiento y la puntualidad que se debe tener en los pagos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. material e insumos para la venta. Son gente alegre, integra y con ganas D. trabajar para el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank called “SEÑOR D. MAYO” is maD. up of women who live primarily in El Alto city. The directors of the group are Patricia, Lizbeth and Graciela. The members of the group dedicate themselves to the sales of a variety of products such as: condiments, canned goods, dairy products, school materials, chocolate and others products. The majority of members know how to work with community groups as this is not the first loan that they have sought as a group. With experience from previous cycles they know about the responsibilities implied in financing and the punctuality they need to have in the payments. The financing will be used to buy materials and goods for sale. They are happy women, supportive, and with great desire to work to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy a variety of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Claudina tiene unos juegos de carrusel y futbolines, se traslada a todas las ferias  de las zonas de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Trabaja con sus dos hijas, y esta separada de su esposo por lo cual es la única que genera ingresos en su familia para poder solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la reparación y mantenimiento de los carruseles ya que estan en mal estado, este crédito será de gran ayuda ya que por el traslado de sus juegos a diferentes zonas se deterioran rápidamente
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Claudina has carousels and football tables (foosball). She travels to all the district markets in the cities of La Paz and El Alto. She works with her two daughters. She is separated from her husband, which means that she is the only one in her family who earns income to pay for the family expenses. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the repair and maintenance of her carousels, which are in bad condition. This loan will be of great help to her because transporting her equipment throughout the different districts has caused it to quickly deteriorate. This is the fourth time she requests a loan from Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a responsible client who makes her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Genera

texts.es:
Genara pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 48 años D. edad y D. su matrimonio ha tenido 5 hijos. Con el apoyo D. su esposo, que es empleado público, también ha podido educar a sus hijos e iniciar su negocio. Debido a que su mayor dificultad fue no tener un trabajo con el cual pudiera apoyar a su esposo, inició un negocio en el campo ferial D. Yungay, en el stand Nº 13, lugar donD. día a día venD. sus productos D. ferretería. Comenta que ha crecido mucho porque inició su negocio con S/.10,000 y ahora comenta que tiene invertido en toda su ferretería un monto aproximado D. S/ 100,000. Viaja hasta la ciudad D. Lima para poder abastecerse D. los productos o D. lo contrario hace los pedidos desD. la ciudad capital.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará tubos, chapas, candados y accesorios D. agua y desagüe.

Genera menciona que le gustaría capacitarse en cuestiones D. crecimiento D. negocio, así mismo agradece al movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla apoyado en el crecimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Genera belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres al Progreso” (“Women Progressing”), located in the Yungay province of Ancash. She is 48 years old and has five children from her marriage. With the support of her husband, who is a public worker, she has also been able to educate her children and start her business. Given that her biggest difficulty was not finding employment to help her husband, she started her business at the Yungay fairgrounds, Stand #13, where day by day she sells hardware supplies. She tells us that the business has grown a great deal because she started with 10,000.00 soles, and now she has about 100,000.00 soles invested in her hardware store. She travels all the way to Lima to be able to stock up on her products or, otherwise, she places orders from the capital city. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, to be repaid in 8 months, she will buy tubing, sheeting, padlocks, and plumbing accessories. Genera mentions that she would like to learn more about expanding the business and, in addition, she thanks the Manuela Ramos movement for having supported her in the growth of her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tubing, sheeting, padlocks, and plumbing accessories.

loans.name: Virna Marilú

texts.es:
Virna pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

A sus 37 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene a su cargo un hijo, que ha sido su mayor reto ocuparse por completo de él. En su vivienda del jr. Santa Rosa s/n, tiene sus productos de belleza los cuales vende a pedido por medio de los catálogos. Comenta que anteriormente vendía abarrotes en su casa, que por dificultad con sus familiares tuvieron que dividir la propiedad, tan es así que ya no pudo tener consigo el negocio de la venta de abarrotes y en su lugar su hermana puso una ferretería, siendo este la mayor dificultad que ha tenido para poder salir adelante. Desde hace un año vende sus productos a pedido donde menciona que empezó con poco y en la actualidad tiene un stock alrededor de S/. 500 que obtiene en las promociones de los productos; además nos comenta que cocina en casa de una persona para ayudarse.

Con este préstamos de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, invertirá en la compra de los productos de belleza en promoción e iniciará el negocio de ropa, para lo cual viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprarlos, así mismo viajará a Trujillo, aprovechando a las clientes que obtuvo con la venta de sus productos de belleza.  

Menciona que le gustaría capacitarse en el manejo de su negocio y también mejorar su vida personal.
texts.en:
Virna belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay, Ancast state, Peru. At 37 years old, she is a single mother with one son who has been her greatest goal in taking care of him. Her home is at jr. Santa Rosa s/n, she has beauty products that she sells by taking catalog orders. She says that previously she sold groceries from her home, because of difficulty with family members they had to divide the property, so she couldn’t have the grocery business alone and in its place her sister opened a hardware store which has been difficult to make successful. For a year she has sold products by order, she mentions she began with little and today has a stock worth around S/.500 that she obtains on sale; in addition she tells us that she also works as a cook in a private home. With this loan for S/.3,000, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products on sale and begin a business selling clothing, for which she will travel to Lima to purchase, and travel to Trujillo to take advantage the customers she had with the selling of her beauty products. She mentions that she would like to educate herself in managing her business and also improve her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products and clothing

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Águilas” ubicado en la Av. Centenario Nº 215, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre, 1 hijo mayor de edad y 2 que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene dos años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora de Educación Inicial y también se dedica a la venta de comida. Por las mañanas trabaja como maestra y tiene el apoyo de su querida madre para preparar sus deliciosos platos de comida.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 6 kilos de pescado, un racimo de plátano, manteles nuevos para sus mesas, sillas, etc.

Gracias a su habilidad el negocio ha crecido y agradece a su familia y al banco comunal por la ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Alicia S. is a member of the Las Águilas (The Eagles) microfinance institute, located on Nº 215 Centenario Avenue, in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and has 1 grown up child and 2 who are still her dependants. She is married, and her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in food sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 2 years. She is currently a preschool teacher who also sells food for a living. In the morning, she works as a teacher, but she also has support from her dear mother to help her prepare their delicious dishes. With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 5 kg of rice, 6 kg of fish, a bunch of plantains, new tablecloths for her tables, chairs, etc. Thanks to her skills, her business has grown, and she gives thanks to her family and the microfinance institute for the help that they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, fish, plantains, tablecloths, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Anamelba

texts.es:
La señora Anamelba pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas ubicado en el Jr. Oscar Benavides Nº. 470, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza (UNIQUE). Tiene 9 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y también tiene como negocio la venta de ropa. En las mañanas se dedica a su bodega y por las tardes reparte su mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de fideos, golosinas, 2 docenas de blusas, faldas, etc.

Anamelba manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que saben trabajar y tiene el deseo de seguir surgiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Anamelba M. is a member of the Las Águilas (The Eagles) microfinance institute, located on Nº. 470 Oscar Benavides Street, in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and single. She decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in selling UNIQUE beauty products. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 9 years. She currently runs a general store from home. She also has a clothing business. In the morning, she minds the store and in the evening, she distributes merchandise to her customers. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of noodles, candy, 2 dozen blouses, skirts, etc. Anamelba states that Manuela Ramos is a big help for all women who know how to work. She wants her business to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods and clothing

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "PARAÍSO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MERCEDES  ELLA ES CASADA Y TIENE CUATRO HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD ; LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS TANBIEN SON MADRES D. FAMILIA, CON NIÑOS MENORES D. CINCO AÑOS. EN SU MAYORÍA LOS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. ROPA, VERDURAS Y VARIEDAD D. CARNE, ENTRE LOS VARONES SE DEDICAN AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO. EN GENERAL TODOS LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN SUS DIFERENTES RUBROS SABEN QUE EL CRECIMIENTO DEL MERCADO LES EXIGE MEJORAR Y AUMENTAR MAS LOS PRODUCTOS A LA VENTA ES POR ESO QUE OPTARON POR UN FINANCIAMIENTO D. LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL. PARA ALGUNOS EL TRABAJO EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ES DESCONOCIDO PERO SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y CON GANAS D. TRABAJAR PARA SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
The "PARAÍSO" ("Paradise") Group is represented by Ms Mercedes. She is married and has four minor children. The other women in the group are also mothers with children under the age of five. For the most part, the members of the group sell clothes, vegetables, and a variety of meats. The men in the group work in public transportation. Generally, all the members have experience in their different businesses. They know that the growth of their businesses will require them to improve and increase the products they sell. For this reason they have decided to request a loan from Agrocapital. This will be the first group loan for some of the members, but they are responsible people who want to work in order to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº. 754, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. un hijo menor D. edad que aún depenD. D. ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. abarrotes. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. Se dedica al cuidado D. su pequeño hijo y a la administración D. su negocio.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. leche, 4 paquetes D. gaseosas, variedades D. golosinas, detergentes, etc.

Elizabeth se siente feliz porque su negocio ha crecido y porque tendrá la oportunidad D. darle una buena educación a su hijo para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the communal bank “Las Solteritas” (“The Single Women”) located at #754 Salaverry Street in the Callería district, Colonel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 39 years old and the single mother of a young son who still depends on her. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in the sale of groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for four years.

Currently, she has a store in her house. She dedicates herself to caring for her small son and to administering her business.

With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two boxes of milk, 4 packets of sodas, a variety of candy, detergents, etc.

Elizabeth feels content because her business has grown and because she will have the opportunity to educate her child so he will have a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two boxes of milk, 4 packets of sodas, a variety of candy, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Lizeth

texts.es:
La señorita Jessica pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº. 745-A, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora de Educación Inicial y se dedica a la venta de golosina y a la venta de gaseosas. En las mañanas trabaja como maestra y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 6 paquetes de galletas de diferente marcas, 2 cajas de chocolates, 8 paquetes de gaseosas descartable, etc.

Jessica se siente realizada porque gracias a la ayuda del banco comunal tiene la oportunidad de apoyar a su querida madre.
texts.en:
Señorita Jessica belongs to the communal bank "Las Solteritas" (the little bachelorettes), which is located at 745-A Salaverry Street, in the district of Callería, in the province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 32 and single. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, she decided to invest in selling sweets. She has worked with the communal bank for 4 years. Currently she is a preschool teacher and sells sweets and soft drinks. In the mornings she works as a teacher and in the afternoons she works at her business. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 6 packages of cookies of different brands, 2 boxes of chocolates, 8 packages of soft drinks, etc. Jessica feels fulfilled because thanks to the help of the communal bank, she has the opportunity to support her beloved mother.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 6 packages of cookies, 2 boxes of chocolates, 8 packages of soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señorita Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas ubicado en el PSJ. Montebello Mz. Nº 143-A, distrito de Yarinacocha, distrito de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de cosméticos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas espaciales para diferentes eventos como 15 años, matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 40 pollos, 5 docenas de platos, 6 docenas de cubiertos y otros.

Laura se siente realizada e independiente y agradece al Banco por la oportunidad que le brinda para tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Ms Laura belongs to the community bank Las Águilas located in the PSJ. Montebello Mz. Nº 143-A, district of Yarinacocha, district of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 27 years old and single. With the first loan of S/. 300 which she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of cosmetics. She has been a member of the community bank for 2 years. Currently, she sells specialized foods for various events such as 15th birthdays, weddings, birthdays, etc. She will use this loan of S/. 1,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, to buy 40 chickens, 5 dozen of plates, 6 dozen cutlery sets and other items. Laura feels fulfilled and independent and she thanks the bank for the opportunity it has given her to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 chickens, 5 dozen plates, 6 dozen cutlery sets, and other items.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas ubicado en el Jr. Huayna Cápac Nº. 198, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 3 que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, refrescos, aguajes, los cuales le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 docenas de blusas, 3 docenas de pantalón, 2 docenas de zapatos, 2 sacos de aguajes y otros. 

Lili agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada y a Dios por todas las cosas buenas que le han pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Lili is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, located in the Jr. Huayna Cápac Nº. 198 disctrict of Manantay, in the province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and a single mother of 6 children, 3 who are grown and 3 who still depend on her. With her first loan of of 300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in selling candy. She has been working with the Banco Comunal for four years. Currently she sells clothing, shoes, soft drinks, and aguajes (a Peruvian fruit), which earns her the profits she needs to make her loan payments on time.

With this loan of $1000 nuevo soles (US $325), which will be paid in five months, she will buy 2 dozen blouses, 3 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen pairs of shoes, and 2 bags of aguajes and other fruit. Lili thanks Manuela Ramos for the help it has given her, and God for all the good things she has experienced in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Caribeñas ubicado en el Jr. José Gálvez Nº.150, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en oficina en el hospital de Pucallpa. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de bellezas (NATURA). En las mañanas se ocupa de su hogar y luego sale a repartir sus productos a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará variedades de productos de belleza (colonias, lápiz labial, perfumes, jabones de cuerpos y otros). 

Maribel manifiesta que recibe un gran apoyo de Manuela Ramos, por eso agradece de corazón al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Caribeñas, located in Jr. José Gálvez Nº.150, in the district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 35 years old, and has one child who depends on her. She is married, and her husband works in an office in the Pucallpa hospital. With her first loan of 300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in selling clothes. She has been working with the communal bank for two years.

Maribel is currently selling beauty products (NATURA). She is at home in the mornings, and goes out in the afternoon to deliver her products to her customers.

With this loan of $1500 nuevo soles (US $500), which will be paid in four months, she will buy a variety of beauty products (colognes, lipsticks, perfumes, body soaps, and more).

Maribel says that Manuela Ramos is a huge help to her, and she gives a heartfelt thanks to the communal bank for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilu pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas, ubicado en el PSJ. Montebello Mz. Nº 143-A, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de autos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas espaciales para diferentes eventos como 15 años, matrimonios, cumpleaños y otros. Trabaja con sus queridas hermanas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 docenas de platos, 3 docenas de fuentes, cubiertos y otros.

Marilu agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda, porque gracias a ello su estabilidad económica y la de su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Marilu belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Águilas, located in PSJ. Montebello Mz. Nº 143-A, in the Yarinacocha district of the province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 47 years old, and has 5 children, 4 grown and one who still depends on her. She is married, and her husband is a driver. With her first loan of $300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos she invested in food sales. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Currently she is catering for special occassions, such as quinceañeras, weddings, and birthdays, among others. She works with her sisters, and they are very close. With this loan of $1200 nuevo soles (US $400), which will be paid in five months, she will buy five dozen plates, 3 dozen serving dishes, silverware, and other items. Marilu thanks Manuela Ramos for the support it gives her, which has helped improve her economic stability and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of dishes and silverware for her catering business.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO VIRGEN D. MARÍA LOURDES REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA YOLANDA TODOS LOS MIEMBROS PERTENECE AL BARRIO LOURDES CONFORMADO POR 15 SOCIOS, ELLOS HAN DEMOSTRADO EN SUS ANTERIORES FINANCIAMIENTOS SER RESPONSABLES SOLIDARIOS Y CUMPLIDOS, TODOS SON VECINOS Y EN SU MAYORÍA PROPIETARIAS D. SUS VIVIENDAS. ALGUNAS SOCIAS VENDEN COMIDAS, OTRAS SE OCUPAN D. GUARDERÍAS, Y LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS TIENE SUS TIENDAS D. BARRIO, LOS SOCIOS VARONES SON TAXISTAS A EXCEPTO D. UN SOLO SOCIO QUE TIENE UNA DESPENSA EN LA CUAL VEND. CARNE VERDURAS Y D. MAS ALIMENTOS. EL DESTINO D. CRÉDITO D. ESTOS SOCIOS ES PARA CAPITAL D. OPERACIONES Y COMPRA D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES O PARA HACER CRECER SUS PEQUEÑOS PUESTOS D. VENTA PARA EL SUSTENTO Y MEJORAMIENTO D. LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen D. Maria Lourdes" is represented by Yolanda. The 15 members of the group live in the Lourdes neighborhood; most of them own their homes. As recipients of past loans, they all have proven to be responsible, caring and reliable. Some of the female members sell food out of their homes, others proviD. child care and others run small corner stores. The male members are taxi drivers, except for one who runs a grocery store. The loan will be used as work capital, and to purchase materials and foodstuffs to restock and make their businesses grow, and ultimately improve their and their families' way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Nelly María

texts.es:
La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, ubicado en el Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres Nº. 605, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como repartidor de arena y ripios. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de plátano. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. Por las noches vende comida típica, el cual le brinda ganancias para cumplir con su responsabilidad de pago.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará, ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, detergentes, etc.

Nelly es una mujer que lucha constantemente por la vida, es trabajadora y optimista para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, located in Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres Nº. 605 in the Manantay district of the province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 38 years old, and has 3 children who depend on her. She is married, and her husband works delivering sand and gravel. With her first loan of $300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in selling plantains. She has been working with the communal bank for four years.

She is currently running a general store out of her house. At night she sells local dishes, which earns her the profits she needs to pay her loans on time.

With this loan of $2000 nuevo soles (US $650), which will be repaid in five months, she will buy half a sack of rice, half a sack of sugar, two crates of milk, detergents, etc.

Nelly is a hardworking woman who struggles constantly for a better life, and is optimistic about her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and sundry items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Noemi Esther

texts.es:
La señora Noemi pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas, ubicado en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº. 237, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 67 años de edad y es madre soltera de 8 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza (UNIQUE). Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de dulces, verduras y productos de belleza. Se dedica tanto a su negocio como a su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 8 kilos de rosquillas, verduras, cremas de manos, colonias y otros.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos y a la ayuda y bendición de Dios su negocio ha crecido y su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Noemi is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Águilas, located in Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº. 237 in the district of Callería of the Coronel Portillo province, departament of Ucayali. She is 67 years old and has eight grown children. With her first loan of $300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in selling beauty products (UNIQUE). She has been working with the communal bank for five years.

Currently, she sells sweets, vegetables, and beauty products. She splits her time evenly between her business and home.

With this loan of $1300 nuevo soles (US $425), which will be repaid in five months, she will buy 8 kilos of donuts, along with vegetables, hand creams, colognes, etc.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, as well as God's help and blessings, her business has grown and her economic stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of food items and beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas ubicado en el Jr. Antonio Maya de Brito Nº. 600, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un motokar como herramienta de trabajo y tiene el apoyo de su hijo mayor. Mientras realiza las actividades del hogar su hijo trabaja en su movilidad.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 4 amortiguadores, 2 telescopios, arreglará el motor, etc. 

Gracias al apoyo del banco comunal ha realizado uno de sus sueños, tener una movilidad propia para mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, located in Jr. Antonio Maya de Brito Nº. 600 in the district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, departament of Ucayali. She is 49 and the single mother of three children, one of whom is grown and two who still depend on her. With her first loan of $300 nuevo soles from Manuela Ramos, she invested in clothing sales. She has been working with the communal bank for three years.

Currently, she owns a motokar (a motorcycle-taxi), with which she operates a taxi business with her oldest son. While she works at home, her son drives the motokar.

With this loan of $1500 nuevo soles (US $500), which will be repaid in five months, she will buy two tires, four shock-absorbers, front forks, repairs to the motor, etc.

Thanks to the support of the communal bank, she has realized one of her dreams: to have her own motokar to help her improve her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of parts and repairs to her motokar.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas ubicado en el Jr. Urubamba Nº. 228, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en el arreglo D. su local. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el alquiler D. su local. Se dedica a su hogar y a administrar su negocio, ahora se encuentra un poco delicada D. salud.   

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, arreglará su local para tener una buena infraestructura. 

Rosa se sienta feliz porque comparte experiencias buenas y positivas con mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Community Bank "Las Aguilas" (meaning, The Eagles) located in Jr. Urubamba No. 228 in the district of Calleria, in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 63 years old, she is a widow and a mother of 5 grown children. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for S/.300 and she decided to invest the funds in remodelling her store. She has been with the Community Bank for the past 2 years.

She currently depends on the store she leases. She spends her time at home and administering her business, especially now that she has failing health.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in 5 months, she remodel her store to improve the infrastructure.

Rosal is happy to have such good and positive experiences with strong and hardworking women.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her store.

loans.name: Annie Kandy

texts.es:
La señora Annie pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas, ubicado el la Av. Faustino Sánchez Carrión Mz. A Lt. 31, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad, aún no tiene hijos, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ladrillos al por mayor y para ello tiene el apoyo de su esposo, ambos trabajan y administran el negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará 10 millares de ladrillos. 

Annie esta contenta porque su negocio ha crecido y agradece a Dios por permitirle compartir momentos agradables a lado de su querido esposo.
texts.en:
Ms. Annie P. is a member of the Las Águilas (The Eagles) microfinance institute, located on Faustino Sánchez Carrión Avenue, block A, lot 31, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and does not have any children yet. She is married and her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in food sales. She has been working with this microfinance institute for 5 years. She currently sells bricks wholesale, with the help of her husband. Both of them work and manage the business. With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 10 thousand bricks. Annie is happy because her business has grown. She thanks God for allowing her to share pleasant moments alongside her beloved husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ten thousand bricks

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Profesora Maria Auxiliadora, casada, es docente del Instituto Nacional de Chontales, tiene 5 hijos; su esposo trabaja en una empresa propia y apoya con los gastos del hogar.  Esta solicitando su 9no credito, el que utilizara para construccion de una tapia de 5 mts de largo con el objetivo de dar mayor seguridad a su familia y la vivienda, pues cuando sale a su trabajo tiene que dejar solos a sus hijos, y con la tapia siente que dara mayor seguridad a ellos.    La profesora R. ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus creditos anteriores y manifiesta que a paesar que en la localidad existen bancos y otras financieras, ella acude a AFODENIC porque siempre ha sido bien atendida y lo mejor es que los intereses y las polícas son más blandas.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora R. is married and is a teacher at the Instituto Nacional de Chontales. She has 5 children and her husband runs his own business and together they support their family. Maria is requesting her ninth loan, which will be used to build a 15-foot wall to enclose her home. She wants to make her home more secure, since her children stay home by themselves when she and her husband go out to work. Mrs. R.'s credit history shows that she is responsible and reliable. She tells us that while banks and other financial institutions exist in her neighborhood, she comes to AFODENIC because she has always been treated well, and the interest and terms are easier to manage.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a wall

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La señora Diana pertenece al Banco Comunal Pastaza ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Barrera Nº 558, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de motos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la administración de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 cientos de pernos, 40 rodajes, 2 docenas de cadenas, 2 docenas de anillos para motos, etc. 

Diana se siente contenta porque ha encontrado la felicidad al lado de su familia y con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana belongs to the Communal bank Pastaza which is located in the Jr. Comandante Barrera # 558 street, in the Calleria district, province of Coronel Portillo, Uyacali department. She is 22 years old and has two children. She is married, and her husband works as a motorcycle mechanic. With the first loan of S./ 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos she invested in the food selling business. She has been working for a year with the communal bank. Currently she works selling repair/spare parts for motorcycles. She has the support of the husband in her business. With the new loan of S./ 1500, which she will repay in 5 moths, she will buy different spare parts, such as 40 gears, 24 chains, 24 rings for motorcycles, etc . Diana is happy because she has found happiness next to her family and her business has grown thanks to the help of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Lirio ("Iris") Village Bank. 
Antonia is 57 years old and married. She runs a store from her home on Garcilazo Street where she sells dry goods, vegetables, and meat from 5am to night. She also has a small workshop in her home where she makes custom clothing and repairs clothing. 
Antonia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy pants and milk for her two businesses. 
Antonia’s dream is to travel to other countries. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio. 

Antonia es casada, tiene 57 años y 7 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicado en el Jr. Gracilazo en donde vende abarrotes, verdura, carnes, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta la noche. Además Antonia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa en donde realiza confección a medida y composturas. 

Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones y leche. 

Los sueños de Antonia son conocer otros países.

loans.use: Buy pants and milk

loans.name: Doris Ortencia

texts.es:
La señora Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Perseverantes ubicado en la Carretera Federico Basadre Mz. N Lt. 02 Km. 6, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad y es madre de una hija menor de edad que aún depende de ella , es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de repuestos para carro. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo y se dedica tanto a su hogar como a su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 4/4 de rodajes, 6/4 de amortiguadores, una docena de celiconas, etc.

Doris se siente realizada como mujer y como madre porque ha logrado estabilizar su negocio para el beneficio de su menor hija.
texts.en:
Señora Doris belongs to the Persistent Women Communal Bank located at Lot 2 Km 6 of Federico Basadre Highway N, district of Callería, Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and is a mother of an under-age daughter that still depends on her. She is married and her husband is independent in her work. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of replacement parts for cars. She has been working with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently she relies on the same business. She has the support of her husband and is dedicated as much to her home as to her business. With this loan of 1,300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 4 sets of rotors, 6 sets of shocks, a dozen tires, etc. Doris feels fulfilled as a woman and a mother because she has managed to stabilize her business for the benefit of her small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car parts such as rotors, shocks and tires for resale

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank. 
Prudencia is a single mother. She is 52 years old and has two children. She has a stand in the Magdalena market where she sells red meat, which she buys in the Nery Garcia market. Prudencia works from 6am to 2pm each day.  Prudencia needs a small loan of 800 soles to buy pork and mutton.  Prudencia’s dreams are to get ahead in life, for her children to grow up to be working professionals, and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Prudencia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Prudencia es madres soltera, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Prudencia tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne roja, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, las carnes los adquiere en el mercado Nery garcía.
Prudencia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de porcino y ovino.
Los sueños de Prudencia son salir adelante, sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio aumente.

loans.use: Buy pork and mutton

loans.name: Elvina

texts.es:
La señora Elvina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas, ubicado el Jr. Grau Nº 190, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad, y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de bellezas. Tiene 9 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, de venta de productos “EBEL”, el cual le brinda ganancias para cumplir con su responsabilidad del préstamo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará variedades de productos como colonias, perfumes, talcos, etc. 

Elvina manifiesta que recibe un apoyo del banco comunal. Gracias a su entusiasmo para el trabajo, sus ganancias y los clientes han aumentado.
texts.en:
Elvina belongs to the communal bank “Las Aguilas” (“The Eagles”) located at #190 Grau Street in the Callería district, Colonel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are grown and one who still depends on her. She is married and her husband works independently. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of beauty products. She has been working with the communal bank for nine years.

Currently, she continues with the same business, selling “EBEL” products which bring her earnings so she can meet her loan responsibility.

With this loan of 1,300.00 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will purchase a variety of products such as colognes, perfumes, talcum powder, etc.

Elvina states that she receives support from the communal bank. Thanks to her enthusiasm for her work, her income and customer base have increased.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase colgnes, perfumes, talcum powders, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank. 
Maria is 42 years old and married with seven children.
